reviews.review_text: Best dog food ever

My dog (lab mix 40lbs) has been eating this for two years and still loves it, as well as my little bitty dog (6lb chi poo). We’ve switched the flavor up and they seem to like all of them. I have never noticed this affecting their tummies either. The ingredients are so much better than a lot of other dog food and I feel good about serving this to a part of the family.
My dogs love this. I have two dogs that willnt eat anything else.

I bought into the marketing hype about how I'm a better dog mom for buying this food. My girl ate it over the course of 8-10 months. There were many times when I'd put it in her bowl and she'd look up at me as if to say, "Ugh, isn't there anything else?" This is a dog who will eat carrots, kale, rabbit poop, dog poop...so I know she's not picky. 😆  All the more reason to investigate when she doesn't like the taste of something.After keeping a poop journal ( because yes, I'm THAT dog mom and also poop tell us what's going on in the body) I realized that her poops were always progressively runny as the day went on. Every. Single. Day. We feed 3x a day and she poops about 3 or 4x per day. I always clean it up, so yeah...I notice the subtle changes in the consistency. The only poop that was 100% solid was the first one of the day. Then it would get softer and softer until it was so runny that we'd go on walks and I couldn't even bag it. Also, she's a long-haired breed, so THAT's been a joy to deal with. 🤮 🤮 🤮I switched to another brand...Wellness https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001BORBHO...and holy 💩, ALL of her poops are ALL NORMAL. She also loves the taste of her new food. I love being able to pick it up after it comes out the other end. I love that I don't have to wash her entire back end after an especially messy poop. I will never buy anything from Blue Buffalo again.
My dog never vomited from his food but after started this brand, he was vomiting twice a day and I had to toss out the whole bag. A waste of money and disappointing. Cannot even get a refund for it

reviews.review_title: Warning on Amazon subscribe and save from this product
reviews.review_text: We love this dog food so much! However, just like all the other reviews warned, do no buy from Amazon “subscribe and save”. Anytime we buy it from the store, our dog Beesly loves it, no problems. My husband got our most recent bag from Amazon (despite me telling him about all these crazy reviews) he didn’t really believe it. Anyway, Beez started having extremely bad gas, was very timid, very lethargic, was barely eating and etc. we kept trying the food for a week, because my husband still didn’t understand how the same food would be so different from one place to another. I finally broke down today and bought a bag from the store. Pictured above are the differences between store bought (the darker one) and the Amazon purchase. It also smelled different. Our dog immediately devoured the store bought side, and the Amazon side is still untouched.We absolutely love Amazon. We’re quite frequent shoppers, and do a lot of subscribe and save. Never had any issues, until this.

reviews.review_title: Beware of purchasing food and having it shipped
reviews.review_text: I purchase Blue Buffalo for my animals all the time. I go to my local pet store to purchase. However, I thought at the time why not “subscribe and save” this would become a major error on my part. I received my package from Amazon and it was a box within a box. Firstly, nothing from Amazon comes undamaged these days. Nothing. The first box was opened. The second box was damaged. But the food looked unharmed. Wasn’t opened. Nothing. So I fed it to my three dogs, and my cat loves to steal their food if any is not eaten. By the very next day ALL FOUR. I repeat, ALL FOUR of my animals were sick. My dogs were pooping blood. Literally. My cat was vomiting and couldn’t even make it to the litter box. My dogs started to vomit and I had endless trips to the vet. Because their food had been messed with. I contacted customer service got a refund, ended my subscription.Thankfully my animals are all fine now but we will NEVER again purchase through the mail. So just beware and be cautious.

reviews.review_title: Do not feed your dog/ pup this SEE FDA!!!!
reviews.review_text: I have always used Blue Buffalo for my 5 yo lab. It was said to be the best on the market when we began when he was a pup... 5 years later and THOUSANDS in vet bills? My 5 yo lab has heart disease- I was told by my vet to see FDA open suits against Blue Buffalo- there is many. Directly causing heart disease/I always purchased this product from Pet store or Bjs.. Devastated about this food/ also beware and look up recalls w dog food- I do not want another dog owner to experience the heart ache as we are enduring... Switched to homemade dog food for my lab - now on our GSD dog- who is a pup we began 4health tracker supply dog food. BOTH a dogs love! Research proteins your dogs need as they grow- chicken is not always the best for higher drive breeds. The people at tracker supply were so knowledgeable, explaining this also.Please research best dogs foods, ask breeders, Vets, look at recalls ( we never did as I never knew)Please don’t believe all the hype on this- 5 year old lab with heart disease- currently have a case w FDAMy dog is dying because of this food!

reviews.review_title: Good quality dog food..especially if your dog might be sensitive
reviews.review_text: If it's in the budget doggie gets a decent brand of food.  There is at least one well regarded dog food review web site that also keeps track of recalls.  After a couple of disasters with pet food made in an unmentionable country or two I try to stick with well regarded brands that aren't made in those countries.  Many brands that used to be good have succumbed to the profit margin unfortunately.  Blue Buffalo consistently gets good reviews and as far as I know has never had a recall at least in recent history.  My dog apparently developed a sensitivity for chicken based dog food which is weird because he can eat fresh chicken with no ill effects meanwhile a chicken based dry food results in an explosively upset stomach (tired of cleaning that mess of puddles up off the floor kind of upset stomach).  My local stores have stopped stocking the big bags of this food which is the best value for the price so I order when I have to and amazon always comes through with the fastest arrival time to my door.  It's tough for me to wrangle a thirty pound bag of food out of the car anyway so shipping's probably the best for me anyway.  My dog seems to enjoy this and when the bag arrives at the front door it always gets wags and five minutes of insistent sniffing when it's taken out of the box.  They have several foods for sensitive metabolisms, apparently chicken sensitivity is common in dogs (if I had to guess I'd say all the junk we shoot chickens up with on the farms, hormones, etc.).  I've used this one and the salmon version he does great on both just the salmon is a bit higher priced.  Normally they say don't suddenly change your dog's diet but when the lamb can't be found he doesn't seem to have an issue going back and forth between this and the salmon.
I love the natural ingredients for my dog. It helps to keep him from having itchy skin. My dog loves it.

Bag came damaged, with an obvious cut, that was partially "repaired" with a sticky tape. Outer box was teared apart as well. My dog didn't say anything, but both of us were not happy with purchase and delivery.
They like it, and I think the ingredients are good, but I’m sick of that fishy breath in my face!
less poop, then some brands

It's ok tho because my black lab eats them up anyway!  My dogs have never had any GI or stomach issues on this food.  They seem happy and it makes me happy too!

My dogs have sensitive tummies and allergies. We tried quite a few different kinds of food and most of them were causing itching and anal gland discomfort. They would vomit bile once or twice a week when their tummies were empty, there was some kind of inflammation going on causing that to happen. The FISH AND RICE flavor have now kept them regular and their coats are gorgeous. There rarely vomit now and only seasonal allergies continue to be a problem with one of these guys. I've been feeding them this flavor and brand for a couple years now. I'll continue to use it, they don't get tired of the flavor, they still gobble it up.Only complaint would be the large price variations from one day to the next. Sometimes it's thirty something, sometimes it's fifty something. Seems like that kind of thing shouldn't be allowed. And when you sign up for the auto-ship I would think you would get the same price, but no, that fluctuates, too. Hard to budget when you don't know what the price will be from one month to the next.

For years, I fed my boxer-pitbull Science Diet dog food. Up until earlier this year I thought it was fine till I noticed he was avoiding the food. I read some reviews that suggested there had been a change in the food, which makes sense as I noticed the kibble shape had changedI decided to switch to a different brand and tried feeding a couple different flavors of Blue Buffalo to my buddy. Initially, he liked it much better than the Science Diet, but almost immediately he began to have really bad gas. It makes sense with a high protein diet, but it’s nearly constant. Additionally, we had a friend that fed his dog a high protein diet for the past several years and his dog now had cardiomyopathy, which had been related to high protein diets, even though it was marketed as “healthier” for dogs and more expensive.I finally decided to try switching again and picked Royal Canin, which came with good reviews from several sources. I’ve been splitting his food to transition him for the past several weeks, but placing each brand on opposite sides of the bowl. He immediately eats all of the Royal Canin and begrudgingly eats the Blue Buffalo. After reading several reviews about quality I decided I’m going to pitch the rest of this dog food. He hates it and I can’t handle any more of his gas.

reviews.review_title: Why the exceptionally large / unaffordable price increase?
reviews.review_text: I needed to purchase a high quality, healthy, weight maintenance dog food for our * year old Lab mix Daisy. She has ballooned to 116 pounds in June since I am no longer able to take her for long walks. With the weight gain she has become lethargic, sleeping all hours even during the day and has become uninterested in playing with any of her toys. In addition to her not getting enough exercise she is acting very depressed and I can relate it to first the loss of mybeloved Australian Sheppard "Dito" 6 months ago and 2 weeks later the death of my wonderful husband in May from COVID.  We all need to exercise and eat our way back to health. I talked to my vet and did my own research and found the Blue Buffalo Healthy Weight Life protection formula. The cost was out of my reach in our local grocery store so I checked here on Amazon. On August 1st I bought a 30 lb bag of the chicken and brown rice formula for $35.53. Daisy did not complain at all as I started to mix it gradually into her food. Feeding her 2 cups twice daily she started to lose weight without begging for scraps or treats so I assume she was satisfied. A visit in September to the vet had a weigh in of 101 pounds. Amazing. She was able to jump up on the bed, looking to play tug with her giant rope and had a little spirit again. The vet wants her at 80 pounds so we intend to keep her on this food. Due to the mixing with daisy's old food for the first 14 day, that bag lasted 7 weeks. I purchased another 30 lb bag on September 20 for $34.26. I was checking prices on Prime Day for many of the deals and decided to buy another bag before I ran out and was shocked to find the price "Starting at $54.88" for the same 30 lb bag and not available as prime. That is a $20.00 increase!! Why?? I will find it very difficult to spend that much and I do not want to switch her food when she is doing so well now. I hope this increase is temporary...please.
This bag was ripped and then taped up and sent to us. This is unacceptable and the dogs deserve to have fresh food that has not been tampered or broken.

reviews.review_title: Arrived punctured; will try to purchase again next time
reviews.review_text: Let me start off by saying, I will continue to feed my dog Blue Buffalo. He’s been fed BB since day one before I even picked him up from his original owner. I’ve continued to feed him BB on and off past 4 years only due to the concern that he might get tired of having the same food ALL the time. I always end up coming back to BB.Well this particular purchase, I disappointedly received the package with a teeny-tiny hole in the bag therefore causing it to be covered in ants while it sat outside my front door (see my attached picture). Thankfully, customer service refunded me 100%. I had to pick up a bag from the local pet store because I timed the dog food to arrive on the day we just ran out completely. She's a picky eater lolI don't know what's in this Healthy Weight stuff, or what's different between this one and the regular Blue Buffalo, but for over a year my dog had 2 pretty large cysts on her neck and her flank, that kept getting bigger and would sometimes burst open and leak, only to fill back up. (Both were benign) The vet told me I could have them removed and gave me an estimate....Within a month of feeding her the Healthy Weight, THEY DISAPPEARED. They're gone.Could the Makers of Blue Buffalo please tell me what's in it or isn't in it, that made the cysts go away?? reviews.review_title: DO NOT BUY BLUE BUFFALO - IT IS DANGEROUS
reviews.review_text: This is my first time to ever write a review on Amazon.  But buyers of this product should beware that you are risking the life and health of your dog.  I am giving this product a 1 because there is not a 0.  We purchased this product because there were so many good reviews on Amazon.  We have 3 golden retrievers.  The oldest, about 8 years old has suffered from Pancreatitis.  She has recovered and we selected this food because of its low fat content and reviews about helping dogs with digestive issues.  We have been making home made food for our dogs but with 3 it was just too much work.  We chose the healthy weight product for this dog and the Lamb and Rice for adult dogs for the other two.After one week on this food, our Golden Retriever started to wobble and seemed week in the back legs.  After 10 days she could not even walk!!!!!  I started doing research and there are LOTS of comments and reviews on Amazon and other sources about issues with this food, many of which are related with not begging able to walk.  I can not understand why a product with such pervasive issues can still be on the market.  Blue Buffalo should be removed form the shelves, because it is DANGEROUS for your animals.We have cancelled the subscription we set up, and will be working very hard to regain the health of our family pet.  I hope that this review helps protect other customers from this dangerous company and product.PLEASE DO NOT BUY ANY BLUE BUFFALO PRODUCTS.

BUY IN STORE DO NOT BUY ON HERE!!! I’ve been buying my dogs blue buffalo from bjs never had an issue and they love it. This passed week I bought a bag off of amazon thinking it would be convenient to have it dropped off. I’ve been using it for a couple days and now my dogs are vomiting blood and have terrible diarrhea. One of my dogs is in terrible condition if god forbid he passes away you WILL hear from my lawyer!!!

reviews.review_title: Switched to a different type of food, but not mad at this one.
reviews.review_text: So, my dog was fine eating this. He started on the puppy formula and progressed to adult formula. His poop was a little yellow and sometimes loose, so I switched him the BB's Limited Ingredient recipe that had lamb to see if that had an effect. I think chicken just isn't something his body handles in larger quantities (treats with chicken do not seem to impact him much), but that isn't the food's fault. Transferring to lamb basically instantly work for him. So, before you blame the brand, give either another protein a shot or try their grain-free or limited options. I try to keep my dog and a fairly monitored diet and preferred limited ingredient items. I did order this using Prime and as a one-time purchase. I do not advise buying food related items from a third party seller, but I have never had an issue with Prime items. The package arrive undamaged and no bug issues. Just make sure you check the bag and expiration before use because if food is exposed or outdated then of course you will see negative side effects. We keep this food in a storage tub in a room not exposed to sunlight, if that matters.

My dog eats once a day around 4 pm just one cup of dry and some chicken.  She's not even done with her first Blue Buffalo bag and she has blown up like a balloon.  I am taking her off this carbohydrate garbage right away.  Found a very low carb dogfood online which is even more expensive then this stuff.  But I'm willing to give it a try, she's getting older and it is hard to control her weight. For the price and the way everyone praises Blue Buffalo I expected better, this stuff is trash.  She exercises every day and is still very active.  But this food is just loaded with carbs and If I keep her on it I know she will have serious health issues.  If I cut her down to a half a cup she's going to keep crying because she's hungry, never buying this brand again.Update: After taking her off the Blue Buffalo and putting her on a new brand "Ketonatural" which I think is a fairly new business.  Regardless, she lost a large amount of weight in just a week.  She developed a layer of fat from the Blue Buffalo that you could feel with your hands and was obviously unhealthy.  The fat is almost completely gone and she is loving the stuff.  Only downside is the price, it was $120 for a 24lb bag and $100 for a 16lb.  Thank God I can afford it but I understand if it's not an option for some.  If this food is causing weight problems, it's all the carbs in these dog foods.  Greedy executives do not care about your dogs health, it's up to you to do the research.

reviews.review_title: Give my dog diarrhea, blood in stool, rash
reviews.review_text: I rarely go online to review products that I use or have used, but after the experience I had with Blue Buffalo Dog Food, specifically, Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula Adult Dog Food – Natural Dry Dog Food for Adult Dogs – Fish and Brown Rice – 30 lb. Bag. I feel I must share this so other dog lovers can make an informed decision. In short, I say stay away from this dog food. My Goldendoodle, Prince, had been eating this dog food (in a beige, bleu, red bag) for two weeks. I started feeding my dog this food April 21st, then two weeks later he had severe diarrhea, with blood and mucus in his stool.  Then this week he develop a rash/yeast infection and started shaking from side to side. He's breathing pattern has change, the rashes on his chest and shoulder are so bad he can hardly lay down or sleep. He sits most of the time during the day and at night. It breaks my heart seeing him this way. He was also lethargic and slow moving all day long (this is an extremely active and fast moving dog, and slow movements is out of character for him). When you touched him, he would yelp in pain. We are at the vet right now couldn't wait to write this review. Shame on you Blue Buffalo with this hype about "holistic life protection" bull caca. I think it would be fair to compensate me my money back. Vet bills are no joke. Hoping he pulls through this nightmare.
My dog has trouble using the bathroom for a while. We tried this dod food and it has helped us out so much! He is finally back to normal!

reviews.review_title: Dont let your dogs pay the price for your convenience
reviews.review_text: There is a major quality control issue with pet foods and similar items being sold by Amazon.  Im disappointed to have let me dog suffer after putting my trust in Amazon. So far there have been 3 items ive bought off Amazon from Amazon that  are inferior to the real items. Like all other reviewers  after  a week eating this food my dog has begun scratching like crazy ,losing hair and breathing heavily. She will no longer eat this food. Went to the local store where pets go and bought the same items and they are  clearly much better quality visually as well as smell and of course my dog has not hesitated to eat as she did with the amazon  bag.  Its only the 1st day hopefully i will see fast improvement of the issues caused by this inferior item. This needs to be investigated. Is it a quality control issue, just cutting cost in the name of profit or something else. This is obviously much more then just a bad batch. Its been dog food, dog toothpaste,  and dog vitamins so far with the same issues.  I will no longer take a chance at my dogs expense just for the convenience of home delivery. Anyone reading this  please  dont allow your dog or other pets to be victim of whatever is at the cause of these issues.  Stay safe

Also no root vegetables, carbs, kibble, grain or most fruit. Inappropriate food for a dog! It turns to sugar in their body causing yeast overgrowth. reviews.review_title: Good quality, don’t listen to the reviews...listen to your dog(s)!!
reviews.review_text: I am not one to take the time to write a review. I generally find no quality in reading other people’s subjective take on this food. Really can a human be subjective when it comes to dog food? Isn’t the dog the only one that can be subjective? Okay so with that out of the way, I appreciate everyone’s negative feedback regarding this food. I understand that it does take time to write these things and put in the mental currency needed to write a good one. So now to my “objective” review of how my dogs seem to like this food. They all LOVE it. I have all three of my dogs on it - my oldest is an 11 yr old boxer with renal failure (she’s on prescription wet food, the Rx dry food is insanely expensive), another is a 6 yr old Boston Terrier that got to be a little chubby so I was looking for her to lose some weight (and with this food she has!) and the last little guy is my newest pup: he’s a 1.5 yr old Brussels Griffon that LOVES to eat everything! (And get loves to eat this food! I’ve had to buy him one of these weird bowls that look like a puzzle just to get him to slow down eating it.)I’ve never noticed any change in production quality, every bag that I’ve received has had a seemingly equal part of their “bits” or whatever they call them. I do mix this with a little bit of wet food for the two smaller pups and quite a bit for my medium-sized aging boxer.So to conclude, don’t listen to the reviews; listen to your dogs! My boxer has always had a sensitive stomach - in fact she was on sensitive stomach Rx dry food before the whole Renal failure hit - and she has not had a single reaction to this food.They have all been chowing down on this food for almost 8 months now I want to say. So yeah it’s Blue Buffalo, it’s quality, don’t let your own “dog-like precocious” feelings vicariously attach to the dog. Because as humans, it’s easy to see “what we want to see” in our dogs!

reviews.review_title: My dog is sick from this food

I started switching him over to Blue Buffalo a couple days ago, mixing half a portion in with his original food. He started getting a bit more sluggish, but we thought nothing of it, thinking he just needed some time to adjust to the switch. He also wouldn't eat the food for long periods of time. He is a picky eater, so again, we thought nothing of it. Now, today, we can barely get him to move.There is clearly something wrong with this food. I guess maybe it only affects a smaller percentage of dogs (visibly) since the overall reviews are really good, or maybe this is only a recent development. Either way, I would not risk feeding your dog this food. Find a different brand.

I hear him/smell him fart at least 10 times a day now, before this we maybe heard him fart a couple times a week.I really believe in Blue Buffalo products so I kept wanting to give this a chance, but I cannot keep risking whatever this is doing to my dogs insides because even if it is not harming him in anyway it cannot be good how it is effecting his bowels.

reviews.review_title: FOUND DISINTEGRATING MOUSE IN FRESHLY OPENED BAG
reviews.review_text: Feeling absolutely DISGUSTED.  For the past two years we have been feeding our dog, Cooper, Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula Natural Adult Dry Dog Food as we were told this was a high-quality food and good for Cooper as he has a mild case of IBS.  Over the past week and a half my dog, Cooper, has been experiencing loose poop and diarrhea - we took him to the vet twice to see what was going on.  The vet took stool samples and did not find any worms or other issues.  We were instructed to do chicken & rice for a few days to see if that helped.  It did - today was the first day to add some of his Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula Natural Adult Dry Dog Food back into his diet and as I was scooping out the kibble, I found TWO DEAD DISINTEGRATING RAT/MOUSE bodies in the kibble.  ARE YOU KIDDING ME!?  We will never buy Blue Buffalo products again as this bag of kibble caused two vet visits and lots of vet bills where the source was the kibble.  My husband and I are absolutely disgusted and are very upset that this 'trusted' brand failed us.

reviews.review_title: I buy it, have no idea the claims are true, and unless you analyze it you can't prove it either!
reviews.review_text: Used to buy this dog food at a local store but unbeknownst to me they were offering me an introductory price and didn't tell me. Suddenly after a year they suddenly jump the price on me almost $20! Or it might be because of the raise in minimum wage and stores are no longer absorbing those costs ... either way can't afford the retailer prices anymore so I found the Blue Buffalo here on Amazon. I find it funny that they offer you the review and ask you about taste oh, I didn't taste it! The dogs eat it but then again the dogs will eat any knock off garbage dog food that I buy as well. Side note Blue Buffalo is suffering a scandal right now that they were adding some kind of meal to their ingredients rather than their claim of real meat being the first ingredient. I don't believe even the high-end dog foods are adding real meat, even though they claim it's chicken beef pork fish I believe we're really getting the by products like lungs intestines cartilage etc. The real meat is going for human consumption at $7 a pound. How can they put real meat in this dog food along with the other binders and fillers process it all and then sell it for $2 a pound? It's like that fast food restaurant that claims 100% beef patties. Don't let that fool you 100% beef can still contain 30% fat, because fat is still considered beef,  part of the cow. They didn't claim 100% lean! There is always this sleight of hand advertising that will trick the mind into thinking you've got something you didn't get. I always get a good chuckle out of other reviews that claim their dog was poisoned by certain foods, or their dog will only eat certain foods , these are the same dogs who probably eat their own excrement and being a dog I guarantee they're licking themselves all over everywhere and probably the owners face as well, yet the owner wants to claim one dog food is better  than another?  Unless he  tasted it, ate it for some time and actually built muscle  and energy  and a shiny coat of hair on himself  I would have to contend  the owner  has no clue whether this dog foods is beneficial or not. So this is still just another high-priced dog food but I buy it so take that with a grain of salt.

reviews.review_title: It’s like having a different dog!
reviews.review_text: Our dog was a little chubby, needing to lose in the neighborhood of 5 lbs to get him to 35 lbs. This food has helped tremendously. We had him on a grain-free blue buffalo before, so we were going to switch anyway (as grain-free has been connected to heart disease). He has lost about 2 lbs over the course of consuming a little over one bag. The real change is in his behavior. He is able to run and jump with more agility. He is so much more playful. He doesn’t get excited to eat like he used to, but I don’t get excited about diet food either.

I have tried a least 10 dog foods and this is by far the best. When I worked in a dog kennel, my boss told me Blue Buffalo was the best brand, but I figured, since it's a little pricier, could it really make such a difference? ABSOLUTELY. My dogs have much more energy, they are actually LOSING WEIGHT and have more visible muscle definition even though I have only reduced their portions by 1/4 of a cup and have not increased their activity. Their coats are so much softer and healthier. If you haven't tried this, please do. It is quality food for your fur babies. :)

Although shipping box was intact, dog food bag had a slit at bottom and some food had spilled out into box.  I do not want to feed this to my dog for fear of some type of contamination.  Product gets 5 stars but bag condition gets zero hence a 3 star rating.

Our sweet Jolene (Airedale Terrier) was going a day or two without eating.  We thought it was possibly because she was eating so much of her little humans' food off their plates, so maybe she just wasn't hungry.  Since it was time to move her from puppy to adult food, I did some research to find out what food was the best for her AND within our budget.  After finding an insanely good deal on Amazon, we went with Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula and my mind was blown.  Jolene is scarfing down her food within minutes at meal time, instead of leaving most of it in the bowl.  This morning, she whined for more (she had already gone 1/2 cup over her per meal time serving, so she didn't get it since we need her to maintain her health) and actually tried to pull and push my husband over to the closet where her food is kept.  I wouldn't have believed it if I hadn't seen it with my own eyes.  Needless to say, we're thrilled with our purchase and won't be cancelling our "subscribe & save" on this product.

We have a 95lb Lab who would pretty much eat anything we put in front of him! That said, he does seem like this food a lot! We switched him to Blue Buffalo from Diamond Naturals grain-free after reading about grain-free foods and their possible long term negative effects on a dog's heart.After switching, I noticed he started to put on some weight (in a good way) as he was always shall we say, athletic in his build. In addition, he had some skin irritations which we battled since he was a pup, and they mysteriously vanished about two months after we switched to Blue Buffalo. Could be a coincidence, but I'm inclined to think not.It's a bit more expensive than what we used to feed him, but he seems healthier and to me, that's worth every penny.

Buying on amazon is also cheaper than the stores, I save around $10-15 a bag and we go through this bag in about a month in a half.

I just threw out 28lbs of my 30lb bag. Somethings wrong. My dog has loved this food but the last bag I bought Nov 11th was spoiled or otherwise tainted. I opened it on Thanksgiving and my dog wouldn’t touch it. Would just walk up, sniff and walk away. He usually voraciously attacks it. I thought maybe there were too many distractions with people food (that he didn’t get) so I didn’t think much of it. Didn’t touch it the whole day breakfast or dinner. The next day his stomach was audibly rumbling, but he still wouldn’t eat it. I fed him some wet food and he attacked it. I tried again with the Blue Buffalo , and this time he did eat a little. But later vomited. I was very concerned he had a blockage or other ailment. I read some reviews here that showed other people had some issues with spoiled Blue Buffalo from Amazon. For a test, I went out to Petsmart and bought a bag of the exact same brand and recipe. Boom!! He’s been eating it like always. No issues. So clearly the bag I bought from Amazon was spoiled. I’m very disappointed and hope there is no permanent damage to my dogs system. Please beware of this. I know Amazon has cheaper prices, and all my previous experiences were good - but I will never buy any food product from them again. Absolutely cannot trust it.

Our dogs have always eaten BB and have routinely gone through periods of vomiting and diarrhea during which we frequently questioned the food.  But, hey, it's Blue Buffalo right?A month or so ago our one dog started having minor seizures along with some vomiting and diarrhea.  Took him to the vet and some of his blood work was off (liver/pancreas) so they started running tests.  Several weeks (and much expense) later, they had no explanation for his condition.  He then refused to touch the Blue Buffalo food but would take other food presented to him.  On a side note, our other dog was also having some vomiting and diarrhea issues during this period.The more research I did some type of toxin was looking like a possible cause.  I then Googled Blue Buffalo and "sick dogs" and was amazed at the results.  Consumer Affairs website is loaded with complaints and they have a 2 star rating with them.  Tons of sick dogs reports.... mostly vomiting, diarrhea, etc.  I've even read of quite a few deaths.We've placed both of them on a different high quality dry food and our sick dog is already looking and acting better.  Hopefully his blood work will show improvement but it's too early to tell.  I'll try to post an update when we have additional information but we're tossing a brand new 38 lb bag (that one from a wholesale club).Please read the numerous reviews just on Amazon of dogs becoming ill from this food.  It's obviously not all bags but something is very wrong and this company has had quality control issues previously from contaminated food.Update:  After being on the new food for about 5 days, both dogs are apparently back to full health (including liver function).

reviews.review_title: Blue Buffalo dog food has kept my pug dog healthy for his entire life!
reviews.review_text:
I have an 11-year-old pug dog named Babu, and we have always fed him Blue Buffalo dog food since he was a baby.  We started him on half-a-cup of Blue Buffalo's 

Chicken & Brown Rice Recipe

   twice a day.  Pug dogs tend to get fat with their diet and lack of exercise.  However, Babu has always been in a good weight range while eating Blue Buffalo food (at around 20-lb).  As Babu got older, our veterinarian wanted us to transition Babu to a senior food which has exactly the same ingredients, but less calories.  We easily transitioned him to the Senior 

Chicken & Brown Rice Recipe

   from Blue Buffalo.Babu has always loved his kibble, but it was starting to get hard on his teeth.  He stopped eating at one point because of this, and we had to hand feed him his kibble one-by-one (which took FOREVER)!  After getting his teeth cleaned and speaking to the vet, they recommended mixing his food with soft/wet canned food.  Luckily, Blue Buffalo also makes canned food, and I purchased the 

Chicken Dinner with Garden Vegetables

  .  We start feeding Babu quarter-of-a-cup of kibble and mixed it in with the soft/wet canned food.  The canned food made the kibble a bit softer and more manageable on Babu's teeth.  Luckily, this worked perfectly, and we never had to feed Babu by hand again!  He chows down his food like a champion.  I want to give a big "thank you" to Blue Buffalo for giving my dog a great life and keeping him healthy for all these years!

Have been feeding my dog this Blue Buffalo food all her life. Decided to buy it at Amazon to have it auto shipped monthly and save a few dollars. I had read some of the reviews of dogs getting sick but wrote them off as isolated incidents or a sudden change in food. 3 weeks into the first bag from Amazon, my dog got sick with diarrhea throughout the day and night. I thought she must have eaten something outside and gave it a couple of days. When there was no improvement I remembered the reviews. I discontinued the food and cooked her extra of my food. Within 24 hours all was normal again. I opened the second bag of food from Amazon the next day. Within hours she was sick again. I went out and bought a different brand and fed her that for a week. No problems. Then bought the Blue Buffalo again from the local distributor and still everything was fine. There was clearly something wrong with the Blue Buffalo food sold on Amazon. Either it was counterfeit or mishandled. I tried to save a few dollars but threw away over $50 worth of food! But I consider myself lucky after reading recent reviews that dogs have died from eating this food. If you love your dog, DO NOT FEED HER THIS FOOD!!

reviews.review_title: DO NOT BUY!! Causes struvite crystals
reviews.review_text: This dog food is known to cause struvite crystals in dogs.  Just had to spend $ at the vet because we thought our toy poodle had a UTI. She had no bacteria, but had struvite crystals, usually associated with UTIs. When I asked my vet how this could be, she asked what food I have been feeding her, and when I told her Blue Buffalo, she immediately said that it causes these crystals. I am grateful that we caught it. I had no idea and so hopefully this review will lead others to STAY AWAY FROM BB!!! Thankfully Amazon refunded the money for the food, but this should never be sold without a major warning on it! Would like to have Amazon or BB refund me for the vet bill also!

I've fed my dog this exact food ever since I got her seven years ago. Yesterday I opened a new bag bought on March 5, and she became sick after eating it, and she is NEVER sick, doesn't get into stuff, had no other food/treats besides this food for dinner. My mom, who lives across the country, also feeds her dog this food and her dog also got sick after eating from a brand new bag purchased around the same time. I checked with some of the other owners in a dog owners' Facebook group I'm part of and several of them have had the exact same experience. Apparently one talked to a manager at her local pet store who said they would no longer be carrying this food as the quality has gone down recently. I will definitely be switching to something else.

reviews.review_title: Skin Reaction and Loss of Appetite
reviews.review_text: After a few weeks on this particular batch my pup has developed a rash / scabs all over her belly (from hind legs to neck) and her appetite has gone to near zero.  She was eating store bought Blue Buffalo Life Protection for the past couple bags and had no reactions.  Unfortunately I purchased 2 30# bags (1 for home 1 for work) so that's a good amount of money I'm tossing in the trash.  I will not be purchasing dog food online again.

reviews.review_title: Food will make your dog a crime fighter!
reviews.review_text: Ok, so the food is good. It is reasonably priced compared to local vendors and it comes in the mail. Those are all the reasons I will recommend this food and have purchased it repeatedly. Our dogs were normal dogs before we started them on a diet of this food. Now our lab has super strength and can fly. Our pit bull has started wearing a cape, utility belt and cowl. I have not seen a mailman or squirrel in months. There are bone shaped bladed boomerangs in almost every tree in the backyard. The neighbor's dog has gone missing and there is only a pile of ash where it used to sit and bark all day long. I hope they don't figure out the amazon password...

reviews.review_title: This gave us a fat dog with room-clearing gas!
reviews.review_text: I purchased this to give our aging dachshund what I thought was a higher quality food.  Instead the food gave her almost constant, smelly gas and by the time she finished the bag she had gained a significant amount of weight (2 lbs on a 14 lb dog).  I called our vet who said both the weight gain and gas were common occurrences with BB and recommended we make a change to another food.  We have and are no longer afraid to be in the same room with her!  ;-)

reviews.review_title: Took A Long Time To Catch On That This Was Killing My Dog...
reviews.review_text: I was previously giving my 8 year old GSD Science Diet Lamb and Rice but I kept hearing about how it wasn't the best and I should switch to Blue Buffalo so I did, even with the extra cost I wanted what was best for my dog. Unfortunately the change happened at the same time as a small procedure and my dog had a lot of problems, most related to inflamed bowel syndrome. The vet and I assumed it was a reaction to the procedure and we tried to manage it with steroids and probiotics.For 6 months my dog was miserable having to urinate all the time from the steroids and having uncontrollable bowel movements frequently. My vet and I were doing everything we could think of because my dog was running out of gas and didn't have much left in him.In a loss for anything else to try I switched him back to Science Diet Lamb and Rice and within a week he was cleared up and we discontinued all the other treatments. He no longer has swollen bowl syndrome but does have a severe allergy to whatever was in the Blue Buffalo food.Be warned, changing foods can cause problems, even if you think you are upgrading to something better. I could have saved myself hundreds of dollars in "premium" dog food and thousands of dollars in "treatments" required by the dog food. I only wish I never did it and never was responsible for my dog going through six months of misery.

reviews.review_title: HARD ROCK BLUEBERRIES CAN BREAK TEETH
reviews.review_text: At over $50 a bag (30#) itis RIDICULOUS THAT a high percentage of ROCKS, aka petrified blueberries, are in each bag by the thousands taking up SPACE is my guess. My 40# dog cannot chew them, my German Shepherd swallows them or spits them out. They can BREAK teeth, people!! I took a hammer to them and it was not easy to break them. WHAT is the REASONING???  They could add softer blueberries (similar to craisins that are chewable), but these ROCKS are harmful. Dont disolve in water either.Is this just a scam to add less real FOOD?  I use a bin and I am guessing 20% are these evil berries!

reviews.review_title: Disappointing - bad quality left dog sick
reviews.review_text: Switched from Hills Science Diet Sensitive Stomach to this. First bag purchased was great - dog took to it easily; and ate it really well. Second bag was a different story. Dog became extremely thirsty; she would throw up the contents of her stomach once a day; for nearly two weeks straight. Spoke with the vet and he suggested it was a gag reflex issue, from lapping air with water. I purchased a bowl with floater device to help reduce the amount of air ingested. Sadly it didn’t work. After two weeks I pulled her off the food and switched her to chicken and rice - assuming her stomach was inflamed and she wasn’t consuming the nutrients needed. She stopped throwing up and returned to her normal self. I’m disappointed in the food; obviously there is an inconsistency either in ingredients used, or an issue with distribution (old food, poor storage?). Aggravated that I spent money on the 30lb bag of food, on a water bowl I didn’t need - and now I’m left scrambling to find a replacement food.

reviews.review_title: My dogs got sick while eating this food from Amazon
reviews.review_text: First, I have 2 dogs that I’ve had for a couple years now and I have been using blue buffalo life protection formula for a few years now. Our dogs never had any issues, normally we do purchase our dog food at petco or pet smart. We bought a bag of dog food from amazon a few months ago and there was no problem. Then we just purchased a bag a few days ago and started feeding our dogs with it. They have had the diarrhea and vomiting since we started feeding them the dog food. We stopped feeding them that food and purchased a bag from petsmart and their diarrhea and vomiting stopped. I’m not positive if we got a defected bag or an old bag that caused this but I’m very upset because my dogs have never had this severe of an issue with eating their food. We literally tried 10 different high-quality dog food so far for my dog who has a really sensitive stomach and nothing seemed to work. The Blue Buffalo really did the trick, she never threw up and this is the first one which doesn't cause her diarrhea. Her hair looks shiny and she likes the taste. She is a high energy dog and I had trouble with previous foods because she actually needed way more than it was suggested on the feeding instruction but with BB she needs a less than suggested on the feeding instructions (I always adjust it to her activities, current weight, weather etc).I found the reviews here really concerning. Many people just switch food from one day to the other and then are surprised that the dog gets sick. A few people said the dog had digestive issues for weeks before visiting the vet... I understand that you are disappointed and worried but I don't think the food is the issue in many of these cases. Also not every food is good for every dog,  but it doesn't mean there is anything wrong with Blue Buffalo, just like there is nothing wrong with the X other premium category food that did not work for us.
I think my dogs are healthier now eating a better dog food and the it is a small price to pay for longer happier and healthier life.

reviews.review_title: Watch out for gimicks - Blue Buffalo is probably not worth the $$ - ask your veterinarian
reviews.review_text: Our Rottweiler puppy came up lame in the left hind leg.  We have a great vet, who does a lot of ortho work with dogs.  He indicated that there was a pretty strong indictment of Blue Buffalo at the last national vet society meeting he attended, mentioning that this gimicky, expensive food is associated with some rather strange issues in dogs, potentially associated with the "over" supply of nutrients for these animals.  People are fixated on getting significant nutritional supplementation for themselves, translating this into needs for their pets as well.  The reality is that canines evolved on rather poor diets and heavily supplemented foods are not really good for our animals.  One of the issues he and other vets is seeing is bone pain and types of arthritis.  He did not go into the suspected pathology but indicated that there is some pretty good evidence that this is being associated with the high nutrition diets that are all the fad right now.  Save your money and go with basic dog foods like those from Purina.  Of note, Purina did an independent assessment of Blue Buffalo after the claim was made that BB has no filler.  It simply is not true.

That being said, I've had this a part of my amazon subscribe and save forever but the last time something was terribly off.Half way into finishing the bag my dog got seriously sick, lost a lot of her hair and even her appetite. She started chewing furiously all herself all over her body and eventually she would smell the kibble and walk away which she never does. At first I thought maybe fleas or mange or something of the sort but after getting her checked out nothing was wrong with her in that sense.I inspected her food and it definitely smelled different than before. I decided to check the reviews on Amazon and saw similar complaints... well I dumped out the entire bag and decided to grab a small bag of the same brand and flavor and what do you know, she ate it like she hadn't seen food in forever.I smelled the new bag of blue buffalo that I purchased from the store and it didnt smell bad at all unlike the one I got from amazon.A few days after feeding her the bag from the store she already had major improvement in her mood and appetite and her hair started growing back. No more biting like crazy either.Needless to say I canceled my amazon subscribe and save and will be getting it from the store from now on. In fact I refuse to buy anything on Amazon that our family ingests or puts on our bodies like lotions and whatnot anymore. I don't know ir its a bad batch or a fake product or what but it's just not worth the risk.

reviews.review_title: Caused bloody stools with our two dogs
reviews.review_text: We've been using Blue Buffalo for over a year now.  One of our dogs has a grain allergy that causes a rash so trying to find grain free food was important to us.  We thought we found that with this food.  Though it does not cause a rash we have even worse issues.  It started with our beagle.  He never wanted to eat this food so we would soften it with water and he begrudgingly ate.  Then with the last couple bags we received he started have bloody loose stools.  We changed his food and the problem went away, but we kept feeding the Blue Buffalo to our hound mix with the grain allergy.  Everything seemed good until we opened the most recent bag we received and the hound started having bloody, loose stools.  As we had seen this before with our beagle we immediately switched our hound to another food and the problem went away.I don't know if this is a quality control issue, changing of source ingredients or something else but I will no longer be using this food and will not recommend it to anyone.I've switched my dogs to ranchers choice from the local agriculture supply store.  Not only is it half the price but both my dogs eat without hesitation and they are noticeably more energetic.

reviews.review_text: **** EDITED to let everyone know our sweet doggie had to be put to sleep yesterday as she was suffering to greatly. I’ll post a picture of that below as to save anyone else from going though what we are.My dog has eaten this exact food for maybe six years without any issues and we always order from Amazon so I’m not certain what happened with this batch. You can also read consumer affairs the reports from the last 2 to 3 weeks about this food to be the same as the complaints here on Amazon. For whatever reason this food is making some dogs very very ill. Are started with vomiting, losing weight, being lethargic and then blood in her stool. Are smaller dog ate about a half of a handful of it and became sick as well, not the food we normally feed him so he was switched back over instantly.....Don’t risk it!!! Of course we tried to call the blue Buffalo number and they won’t be open again for phone calls until Monday and I got that email after they were already closed on a Friday night :(Younger dog may bounce back more quickly but due to my dogs age they aren’t sure she is going to pull through. She has jaundice and her liver is not working properly...She was a perfectly healthy dog before eating this last batch of food.

reviews.review_title: DO NOT buy this food, it will make your dogs sick!!!
reviews.review_text: After feeding this food to my 4 dogs for a month and a half, not only do I have 4 VERY sick dogs, but we also acquired $1000 in vet bills.  After starting on the second bag (both purchased through Amazon), one of our dogs got terribly sick (vomiting profusely and bloody diarrhea), so sick we had to take her to a 24 hour vet clinic.  Blood work, full exam, stool sample, you name it, they were stumped.  We got a couple of prescriptions for her and fed her a bland diet of boiled chicken and white rice.  She improved.  Once she improved, the other 3 began to get sick.  In a week's time, they all lost a noticeable amount of weight from vomiting so much and not eating.  I went to the pet store and purchased a different brand of dog food.  When I gave it to them, they all scarfed it down immediately.  They wouldn't even go near the Blue Buffalo food.  Not only would we like a refund for the full bag of food that I have and will not give my dogs, but we would also like to be reimbursed for the vet bills we incurred due to this food!  DO NOT buy this food, it will make your dogs sick!!!

reviews.review_title: Caused stomach upset with our dog
reviews.review_text: We recently decided that we needed to put our dog on a little bit of a diet. We had been using the original Blue Buffalo (the blue bag) and our dog loved it. Shortly after we switched over to this, we noticed that our dog would throw up about once every three to five days. We changed a lot of other things (we cut out all treats and monitored her closely outside to make sure she wasn't getting into something she wasn't supposed to) and still it continued to happen. As a last effort before going to the vet with the problem, we stopped using this food and the throwing up stopped. We have been off the food for a little over a month and we have not had one other throw up incident. We like Blue Buffalo but something about their diet formula was detrimental to our dogs health. I do not recommend this product.

I am a loyal Blue Buffalo customer and I attempted to switch to automatic delivery service so we don’t ever run out. My dogs only eat grain free Blue Buffalo Basic, and I was looking for a different flavor from this line, but I bought this specific bag by accident. Every single time we’ve tried slowly introducing a different brand dog food, grain free or not, my Frenchie has an instant, horrible allergic reaction with intense itching and he’s covered in breakouts that have to be medically treated for days after discontinuing use of the food. I’m pretty convinced I’ve actually created the allergy issue by only feeding him grain free food from a puppy, also because a milder version of this experience also happens now to our other dog that was a 14 month old rescue with no known allergies when we got her, and I’m certain the Humane Society as wonderful as they are, were not providing the dogs with grain free food lol, but that’s another topic. I had every intention on returning this bag and getting the correct one but my boyfriend didn’t realize it and already fed it to our 4 dogs. After I realized they had been eating it for 2 days, I noticed that our Frenchie only had a very mild visible allergic skin reaction I had to search for, but he didn’t display any discomfort or agitation. None of our other dogs showed any skin irritation or digestive issues after eating this food, like they would with another brands grain free food. I still switched them back to the Blue Buffalo Basic, but now it makes me wonder if they are just a reaction to grains, or if it’s something else that’s in other brand dog food they’re reacting to, if the reactions are from the other brands having lower quality ingredients than Blue Buffalo, or something I haven’t thought of. Either way, Blue Buffalo grain free or with grains have only ever proven to be an amazing pet food brand with products that I can trust and I will be forever loyal to.The flavor from this Blue Buffalo line of dog food specifically, my dogs and I were very happy with and I would highly recommend.

reviews.review_title: He seems to like this a lot more

Here is possibly TMI...my dog started pooping SO MUCH on her old food! It was Kirkland turkey and sweet potato which had been fine for years. Maybe they changed their formula, I dunno. She was going outside to go poop 5 or 6 times a day, minimum. She used to go just twice a day, after breakfast and after dinner. Plus, it was like soft serve ice cream, mushy and hard to pick up. And clearly her bottom was irritated, she was licking it a lot. Super gross, all the way around.So I decided to try this Blue formula. I used to have a cat with health problems that did really well on the Blue brand so trying it for my dog was an easy decision. We started with a 25/75 new/old food ratio and by the time we were 50/50 I noticed a difference. Her poops were more solid and there were less of them. It is day 1 of just this new food now. She has been out to go potty twice, and only pooped right after breakfast, and I am thrilled! Again, TMI but it is harder, drier poop. Easier to pick up and doesn't smell as gross either.Even though it is spendier than the Costco food, ordering thru Amazon was cheaper than any local store's sale price and I love that it came to my door, rather than me schlepping it in and out of a cart, my car and up the stairs to my place. But we are so happy with this food that I dont mind paying more and would gladly schlepp it anywhere!

Right away I’ve noticed such a difference! I started her on the food Monday 1/15/18 and today Friday 1/19/18 she’s already gained back so much weight and she looks so much better I could just cry!The first picture is Monday and the second is today (Friday). It shouldn’t be much longer before she’s back to her normal weight!

reviews.review_title: Caused my dog to be severely ill and spent $100s at the vet
reviews.review_text: My dog has been so sick with first bloody stools, to now 5 pounds of weight loss, and chronic nonstop bloody diarrhea. I have spent over $600 at the vet trying to understand what is wrong my Ernie...I am finally realizing its this food!!!  There must be something in it that causes an allergy, I would hate to believe the other comments suggesting Amazon tampers with the food and its fraudulent.  To make the case, we started feeding him the food about 2 months ago, he started having discolored stools but we thought he maybe ate a toy or something. A couple weeks later, I took him to the vet. They ran blood work, he was fine, so they gave him antibiotics and a bland diet of plain rice and boiled chicken, he started doing better so we reintroduced the kibble.  He has had full blown bloody diarrhea and vomiting.  He has stopped eating, he has lost 5 pounds and he is extremely thirsty bc he is so dehydrated.  We switched him back to rice and boiled chicken, and he is feeling better within hours.  I feel awful for feeding him this garbage poison!!  Stay away from this line of blue buffalo!!!!

reviews.review_title: Always Fresh. High Quality. Great Price. Keep reading for a short intro to Cold and Hot proteins.
reviews.review_text: I really like the Blue Buffalo brand. I work for a small pet feed store and even with my 20% discount at work, I get a better deal here. We currently feed the Whitefish and brown rice flavor.  I read another review where the reviewer stated that the bag they received from Amazon did not have a pungent fish aroma like bags bought elsewhere. FYI  If you purchase the fish flavor, it should NOT smell strongly of fish. When you get the strong fishy smell, that is because the fish oils in the product have turned rancid.  Fish oils can turn rancid pretty quickly, so if you receive a bag that has no odor, trust that you have gotten a very fresh bag. A slight fish odor is normal. Slight being the key word here. It should not be overpowering.On to flavor choices. When choosing a flavor or meat source for your dog food, you need to first consider whether your dog needs a "hot" protein or a "cold" protein based on their specific health needs/personality.  This subject can get very deep and intricate, so it is highly recommended to learn and investigate to fully understand the subject. Food has intrinsic properties that can help balance bodily energy. So dogs who tend toward an overbalance of “hot” energy should consume cooling foods, while those who tend to be "cold" in nature should consume warming foods.For example, my lab suffers from anxiety (hot energy). We used to feed the lamb formula, knowing nothing about hot or cold proteins at the time. As it turns out, lamb is one of the hottest proteins available. This was actually making his anxiety worse. We worked with a trainer who suggested switching the flavor of food we fed and gave us information about hot and cold proteins.  By switching his food to the Whitefish flavor, which is cooling, we have seen a drastic improvement in his anxiety levels. Sometimes I am still in awe as to how something as simple as switching the main source of protein in his diet has helped him so much. This also goes for many dogs with allergies, the flavor you are feeding could be the culprit!If you are switching from another brand of food, please take your time and acclimate your dog or puppy slowly! Blue Buffalo is very rich in protein so it is important that you switch your dogs food gradually from his current food to avoid digestive upset or tummy trouble. (This goes for all brands, not just switching to Blue) To transition, mix your dog’s current food with his new food. Over 7 days, gradually decrease the amount of the current dog food while increasing the amount of new dog food. Using this method for transitioning, I have had great results. Day 1 & 2  25% new and 75% current. Days 3 & 4  50% new with 50% current, Days 5 & 6 75% new to 25% current and on the 7th day I feed 100% new. Every dog is different and some need a few extra days to acclimate. Watch their stools each day to decide if you should increase the % of new food.

reviews.review_title: This seem to cause our pets to vomit. Didn't ...
reviews.review_text: This seem to cause our pets to vomit. Didn't work for us.

(sigh), Well this is a situation, at least for us, where we believed the advertising before consulting with our vet.  When we took our new adopted Pit Bull in for her first checkup, we were asked what we were feeding her.  We proudly said that we were feeding Blue Buffalo poultry and brown rice.  The response was immediate.  Stop feeding it, don't use any Blue Buffalo products and use the Science Diet she was getting at the shelter.  He said that they are seeing problems with the Blue Buffalo causing vomiting and diahheria (sp).  We had actually seen her vomit that morning, but figured she had eaten something in the yard that didn't agree with her.  For those of you getting a good result, that's awesome!  But since even the product description says to consult your vet, we are going to go with the advice of our vet and stop feeding this product.  I was disappointed because not only did I think I was feeding a healthy food, I also thought I was supporting a product made in the USA.  From now on, we will ask first before making a diet change instead of after.

After 3 days of giving the food ,my dog was vomiting a lot of saliva and losing a lot of hair.  We took him to emergency room, he was hospitalized for 2 nights ($$$), the diagnosis results showed that we was fine (blood analysis and fecal) , but dehydrated.  They then RX canned food (digestive something), he was fine for a week till the food was over and as we started mixing the blue buffalo with the canned food.  Vomiting again... We changed to another brand (Wellness core) and now he is fine and energized, best of all happy.

reviews.review_title: I thought I was doing something to benefit my dog ...
reviews.review_text: I thought I was doing something to benefit my dog by changing to this higher end brand, but instead I almost killed her.  My  dog developed acute pancreatitis and had to be hospitalized a couple months after switching  to Blue Buffalo Small Bites Chicken and Rice.  She had no prior health issues and did not get into anything else in the house; the only change in her diet was the kibble.  The vet advised she has seen several cases of acute pancreatitis in healthy dogs where owners reported their dogs did not eat anything not intended for them. The vet pointed out that I may want to take into consideration that the only common factor in the cases she had seen recently was that all of the dogs were on some Blue Buffalo formula.  That may not be solid evidence for some but after having my dog go from healthy to having sudden diarrhea, rectal bleeding and dehydration (not to mention the $1000 bill for medical care) I threw out the remaining half of the bag and went back to Royal Canin.

This is going to sound biased, but bear with me.My pup Bagsby (11 month old pit mix) is amazing and I love him to death. I knew as soon as I adopted him that I wanted to do what was best for him, and this included buying the right dog food. My dad works for Blue Buffalo (I know, again, sounds biased), but he has also worked for Iams, Doane and Kent. I called him when I got Bagsby and I asked him for his honest opinion of what dog food to buy. He told me to buy Blue Buffalo Life Protection Formula. I asked if it was because he was working for them now, and he told me that this wasn't the case--it really is the best dog food. Keep in mind my dad has been in the industry for 30+ years. Well, I bought it and haven't looked back. My dog's coat is shiny and soft, his energy levels are good, his weight is fine and he is overall very healthy. He absolutely loves his food, and he maintains perfect weight with a reasonable amount of food. As far as price goes, I honestly haven't even thought about it. I literally bought him Blue Buffalo and haven't changed it.I highly recommend Blue Buffalo. Don't feed your dog junk...they're your buddy and your family. reviews.review_title: kind of like pimples on her belly and behind/in her ears
reviews.review_text: I do not normally self diagnose but with all the reviews I have read and the problems my dog is having I will never feed this to her again. Luna is a female golden only 5 months old. We have been giving her this food from the day we brought her home. About a month ago some weird stuff started happening to her, it started with a rash, kind of like pimples on her belly and behind/in her ears. We took her in to the vet and the vet gave us antibacterial shampoo to bathe her in. It didn't do squat. Then she started to vomit occasionally, I just thought it was her being a dumb puppy eating stuff she shouldn't. Then came the diarrhea, she couldn't control it, not fun to clean mind you. After getting concerned I started reading reviews on another website on blue buffalo. I found out they were taken to court for false advertisement by Purina after Purina tested their food to see if it really contained the ingredient they claimed. Well it didn't, it contains more (meal) than most other pet foods. Then I find out they out sourced manufacturing to China so who knows what they put in the food now. Back to my dog not wanting to eat her food, she wouldn't touch the food, Luna is the kind of dog that would eat your hand if it was in the bowl while she was eating so I know she isn't picky. So I went and bought another brand of food to test my theory and other peoples as well. I put some in her food dish and she still wouldn't touch it! After reading a bit more someone had the same issue except the next time they put it in a different dish so it wouldn't have the same smell as the blue buffalo food and their dog ate it right up. So I tried the same thing and she ate no problem. The symptoms are gone but I sure as well will never use BB or recommend it to anyone else again. I felt I should share this story for other people experiencing the same problems, mind you not every person is having these issues but there are lots that are.

reviews.review_title: Blue Buffalo does an excellent job providing dog foods that are specified for certain ...
reviews.review_text: Blue Buffalo dog food appeals to any dog owner no matter the size or breed. Blue Buffalo provides dog food options of various flavors, dog breeds and age of a dog. They have dog food for large, small, young, and old dogs. Blue Buffalo does an excellent job providing dog foods that are specified for certain needs, but also general diets. Blue Buffalo is a safe, healthy product to feed any dog. It does not contain any by-product meal, corn, wheat, or artificial flavors.The kibble size ranges from the size of an eraser to about the size of a nickel. My dog has never had issues breaking up the puppy or the adult dog food. Blue Buffalo does provide the option of soft dog food if your dog has any issue biting or chewing on hard foods.I usually purchase the 15 pound bag of dog food and it lasts me about 30-35 days. My dog is around 25 pounds and eats a cup of food in the morning and night. This will vary between owner because of different breeds and schedules. Basing your decision off of my dog and schedule I hope it helps you decide which size would be best for your dog.Many users may be skeptical to purchase Blue Buffalo because of the price, but I would say it is well worth it. I have often found Blue Buffalo food on sale or coupons in store advertisements. I would recommend shopping around to ensure the best deal on this product.I have found my dog to love this dog food. He has been fed this from puppy to his current age of two. I have tried several different dog food brands and experienced many issues with stool and energy level upon switching away from Blue Buffalo. Once I had changed back to Blue Buffalo, the negative symptoms ceased. I have witnessed a positive change in energy, stool, behavior, and coat while he has been eating Blue Buffalo dog food products.

reviews.review_title: DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT ONLINE -- skin irritations and vomiting...
reviews.review_text: It's great that it's affordable, but this brand (at least the product being sold online) messed up my dogs so badly. I have a Yorkie- Maltese who began throwing up at least once a day for this entire month. I couldn't wrap my head around why this was happening. He's 11 years old, an older dog, and I had researched he may need to eat less and more often throughout the day to keep him from throwing up and having his stomach empty. It seemed to help at first, but even when he was being fed more often he was still throwing up yellow foam. I also have a german shepherd/retriever mix and he has been itching non-stop and his skin has been irritated and red.I've been looking more closely into the reviews for this product and down to even they way the online brand kibble looks (pale and stale looking) to being store bought (darker colored) there has to be something happening with the online products of this brand. I know that Blue brand is a highly recommended dog food with better ingredients than the grocery store brands of dog food, but I definitely recommend you doing your research before purchasing this brand online. There are so many reviews saying it caused their dogs skin irritation and vomiting and I have witnessed this first hand. Both of my dogs, even the 11-year-old Morkie, are in perfect health with no prior skin irritations or health dificiencies.I recommend purchasing this brand in stores and NOT ONLINE. There are other brands on here that have better reviews that you should look into. I've already ordered the Diamond Brand dog food found here: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00BVUBBPG/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1I know purchasing good dog food in a 30 pound (or really any quantity) can be expensive and I am all for purchasing online, but DO YOUR RESEARCH! Good luck!

Our 7 year old Australian Shepherd was having very severe skin issues.  Our vet couldn't find the cause and suggested to switch foods.  We'd been feeding Merrick & Merrick's cheaper brand Whole Earth Farms for years, never thinking it was the food since his potty time was always fine & other than the skin issues he was in great health.  Being so sick & tired of his poor skin problems I gave Blue Buffalo a shot & I gave it several bags before I made a decision as to if it was helping at all or doing nothing.  I figured the food would probably have nothing to do with any of the skin issues and was just taking a shot in the dark picking Blue Buffalo.  I was absolutely shocked that his skin issues are totally 100% gone now - all cleared up & 100% healed!  Now I do want to be super clear here & state that I honestly believe it was the removal of his old food that was what caused this amazing improvement, not the addition of Blue Buffalo.  Hope that makes sense!I mean that, I think any other good quality food would have very likely caused improvement in his skin issues.  I just happened to choose Blue Buffalo & it just happened to work great for us!  It's good quality nutrition, our Aussie seems to like the taste, it's always available here on Amazon & if for some reason I don't want the Chicken & Rice at any point there are plenty other varieties to choose from.  I really love when pet food companies have various kinds & flavors so we can keep our dog's digestive system regular & give him some variety to keep him excited about food!  We can switch between any of the varieties without any fuss because most of them have very similar ingredients. The biggest positive I can report is, we didn't transition him at all from his old food to Blue Buffalo.  So we were expecting some not-so-great potty results.  Nope!  All went smooth & no changes in his digestive system!  We have ALWAYS had major trouble if we didn't switch him slowly, so I was really surprised nothing happened negatively & his food transition went as easy as pie!  I personally as of now highly recommend Blue Buffalo!

reviews.review_text: First off, I'll give you a little background on my dog and tell you why I prefer this particular brand so much. I have a French bulldog who is almost 10 years old and he is a big fan of all food especially the human variety. The main issue I've always had with him and I know he isn't the only bulldog guilty of this, but he is a VERY gassy little dude. His stomach is so finnacky that I've found no food that can completely conquer the gas problem. This particular brand is well known for being top notch and I'll tell you it's been by far the best dog food I've ever fed my guy. First off he loves it and always dances and jumps when he knows I'm filling his bowl. Secondly, and maybe no less important it has really helped control his gassy reactions to most any food he eats. It's been a god send for me because this guy could clear out one level of my house on most any other food. Needless to say, I highly recommend Blue and this particular variety in particular for your pet.

My dog is going on about 15 years old and is 50 pounds. Almost half of his teeth have been removed (see below for why I recommend the small bite formula). I wish I had fed him food of this quality all these years.I made the switch over to Blue Buffalo about a year ago from 

Taste of the Wild Dry Dog Food, Hi Prairie Canine Formula with Roasted Bison & Venison, 30-Pound Bag

  . He gobbled up the chicken and brown rice flavor right away. I noticed the following benefits within the first week of feeding him this:1. Noticeable energy - he is up and running around a little more than usual. He also has a more lively look in his eyes.2. Appetite - his appetite neither went up nor down, but I have noticed that he loves this food. At first he ate about a half to a full cup more than I normally give him, but that tapered back down to his normal amount by the end of the first week.3. Digestion - I have purchased both the regular and small bite pellet sizes, and he digests the small bite pellets better. He has had many teeth removed, so I have noticed that the small bite formula is easier on his gums and teeth.Overall, I highly recommend this food. You pay more for it, but I noticed an immediate difference in my dog's health. To me, that's worth the price. If your dog has had teeth removed, then I also recommend their small bite formula.

We tried Iams which really did not work for her so we are switching her back to this food. The vet recommended a bland diet for two weeks.  When we return her to a regular diet, we need to leave this food behind and likely will switch to grain-free or limited-ingredient type of kibble at least for a while until we know what is giving her the skin and digestive problems.

After about 8 months, our dog had been experiencing an inordinate amount of ear infections, and then one day he decided he didn't want to eat his Iams anymore. We tried everything to get him to eat and he wouldn't. Finally we decided to switch to Blue Buffalo, which we wanted to give him from the start but were talked out of, and he immediately loved it. He's been on it for about 7 months now and hasn't had a single ear infection, his energy is better, his coat is much shinier and softer, and he's much more regular in his bowel movements. Blue Buffalo has been a miracle for us.  When we first got our sweet little girl, she was already two years old and had lived a rough life with not the best care or food.  We were told that she was fed a store brand generic food, which she would gobble down as fast as she could when it was in front of her.  After a few weeks we started having issues with our new family member, it seemed like every other day she was having a seizure which usually occurred a few hours after her food was eaten.  After numerous vet appointments the suggestion was made to give her a better food, so after quite a bit of research we settled on Blue Buffalo.  I am happy to say that we have now had our Baby Girl for 5 years and we have been seizure free since the switch.  I can honestly say you get for what you pay for in this case, she has more energy, her coat looks 100% better, and she no longer gobbles down her food, but enjoys it throughout the day. I highly recommend Blue to anyone that has a dog or cat, its simply one of the best foods on the market.  Thank You Blue for helping our little girl and making her a permanent part of our family.

My dogs love this stuff. I have a Boston terrier and a (wait for it) a Basset-Doodle... Bassetoodle? Basset-poo? Poodle Hound? Well, anyway, she's half Basset Hound and half miniature poodle, making her 100% French, and kind of picky. The food her breeder (I know, hard to imagine what they were thinking) had been feeding her was full of food coloring (and possibly roadkill)... That poor puppy threw up every day until I switched her to Blue Buffalo. My Boston is a little sensitive to wheat, so I needed to accommodate their very different issues if possible. Both of my dogs are seniors now, though I feed them this regular adult dog formula, and very healthy. Amazon tends to have a great price on this product.Here's the reason for only four stars, and not five. The good news -- buying from Amazon means I don't have to drive (28 miles) to a specialty pet supply place, somehow get help to convey a heavy bag off the shelf, cart it through the store and hoist it into my car. HOWEVER, and this might be the only downside, I get it delivered to my PO Box. Both the postmaster and I wish it could be shipped to my front door -- it's super heavy, and neither one of us is all that strong. She refuses to lift it at all. So, I get to drag it through the post office, out the heavy door, hoist it into my car, and unload it myself at the house... In summary, delivery to my front porch would earn this Amazon offering five stars in my book!
