This dog food was recalled. Our dog spent a week in the hospital. It all started with her not eating this food. We thought she was going on a hunger strike. I mixed in some pumpkin and she ate the food. She threw up. We thought she was having stomach issues. We decided to switch to the Blue Buffalo Salmon. We were mixing 1/4 cups Salmon with 3/4 cup white fish and sweet potato to transition her off. She was throwing up violently and had diarrhea. We took her to emergency care and she was admitted to the hospital on and off for a week. They did x-rays and and ultrasound and found no foreign bodies. They said it was something she ate. Amazon was nice enough to give us a heads up that the food we bought had been recalled. I called Blue Buffalo and they were on the defense with canned answers. "we are not vets" "there is no proof our dog food made your dog sick" they said there is nothing they can do to help. After $4000 in vet bills and our dog who is 2 years old is still on meds after almost a week and can't hold her pee.

reviews.review_title: Not the same product as the stores....not recommended
reviews.review_text: This is not the same product sold in stores such as Petsmart. My dog got major food allergies and I had to spend over $500 to help him recover. When I first bought it I was so glad that it was much less than the store price and as he started to eat it he started to nibble on his feet alot and then it just started getting worse and was tearing the skin off all 4 of his feet. I took him to the vet and had to do multiple testing to figure out what exactly the problem was. Then the vet said it was most likely food allergies and I had to put him on a veterinary diet that pretty much healed him with multiple rounds of medications. After some time I decided to look at and read the packaging of this product a little more. I noticed that the package was completely different and I assumed since it was coming from some other location that it was different. Then I started to notice that the food even looked a little different. The pebbles were a different size than the one you can buy at Petsmart as well. This is a replica of the original Blue Buffalo brand and I couldn't believe that it was endorsed by them. I'm beginning to wonder if I should even continue using Blue Buffalo brand because it is so hyped up by the media. There are many other brands that are far better than blue buffalo and more natural and safe. I am not recommending buying dog food from any online store because you really don't know where its coming from and where it's made. At least you know you can return it at a pets store if you buy it from there without having to pay return shipping or pay any restocking fees. If you really care about your dog and if you really don't care about your dog (maybe you shouldn't have one) then get what's best for them because they are innocent creatures and all they want to do is make you happy and you are the most important thing to them in this world.

Just a few days ago we took one cat to the vet and she had a UTI combined with swollen/inflamed bowels. Never had we had problems before, until BB. I didn't want to wait until any of my other cats or dogs got sick so we just threw out all the BB food. I had read the bad reviews here on amazon but I didn't think that such a well known brand of food could be bad. I figured the reviews were probably just lies to try and sway people to another brand, or that maybe it was just a coincidence that certain pets got sick-not because of BB. But now I saw for myself that although this food is good, it is actually too good; its not balanced which can cause issues in the animals. Do research on BB before you decide whether its the right fit for your animals.

He started throwing up regularly, and his skin and coat were much drier and less shiny. I switched to a totally different brand, and he has been perfectly fine every since. reviews.review_title: Our dog is much healthier eating Blue!
reviews.review_text: Cannot say enough good things about this dog food! We had switched our almost 3 year old golden to Hills Science Diet Perfect Weight after our vet recommended it.  She did not loose any weight and was acting lethargic, shedding, and hungry all the time.  Several friends told us to switch her food, and we are so glad we chose this one!  Within two weeks she was back to her puppy-like self; active, happy, and not shedding.  A few friends have told us she looks thinner, but we have not weighed her yet.  We also add 1/2 cup of green beans to her twice daily 1 1/4 cup feeding.  She seems to be begging less and feeling better.  This dog food gave us back our puppy!

reviews.review_title: Good food for my diabetic dog...except for those life bits
reviews.review_text: This food is a saving grace for my diabetic mini-schnauzer.  The vet put him on Hill's high fiber prescription diabetic food and he simply would not eat it.  We checked around for the food that had the same fiber and protein contents as the Hill's prescription food (that has to be bought at specialty stores or the vet's office for high $$$) and this came very close to percentages and ratios.  The taste seems 100% better to the point where he eats it without complaint.The only issue I have with this food is those "life bits".  I have 3 dogs which all eat this food exclusively but there is a bit of an issue with them eating the life bits.  I don't know if they are not good tasting or what but I watch my dogs pick up food, eat the kibble and spit out the life bits. It has become a comical response when the wife of I step on one on the floor and curse out the dogs for not eating their life bits.  Aside from that, no issues and I don't mind spending the $$$ to buy this over other brands.

I changed to Blue Buffalo Life Protection after spending a week at my Mom's farm. I have always been conscientious of the food I get for my dogs, but I had noticed that over the winter their coats had a lot of visible dander and were just overall dull. After the week on Blue Buffalo there were visible improvements to their coats and I decided to purchase a bag of my own when I returned home. While the cost might put some off initially, I can attest as an owner of 3 40+ lb dogs, that due to the high quality of the food you actually feed your dogs less and they get more in the way of nutrients than less expensive brands. Overall, six months on, the dogs' health has improved and I am very satisfied with this product.***Update***I used Blue Buffalo for several months until my dogs all became inexplicably ill - not eating, vomiting, diarrhea, fever, shakes, and general distress. After trip to ER vet (at a great cost with 3 dogs), I was told to put them on a bland diet for 3-5 days and slowly reintroduce their food. The hypothesis from the vet was that they may have gotten into "something", but whatever it was, it was not lethal. Followed the prescription diet and then slowly reintroduced Blue Buffalo and WHAM! all three were experiencing the same symptoms as before. Another trip to the ER and the vet suggested it might be the food and to take them off it completely. I did and am happy to say several years later - all of which the dogs have been on Costco's Kirkland brand - we have had zero bouts of intestinal distress. Granted, I may have just gotten a "bad" bag, but with my dogs, I am not willing to risk it.

Just yesterday we ran out of dog food so I returned to the store and purchased the Blue Buffalo fish & sweet potato variety and this morning my dog's anal glands are already impacted and stinky. reviews.review_title: NOT the same product as sold in pet stores. MADE OUR DOG SICK.
reviews.review_text: This was absolutely NOT the same product that we buy from the pet store. Our dog loves Blue Buffalo Lamb & Rice and has been eating it since the day we adopted him. We always buy our dog food at Petsmart or Pet Supermarket, with great results. This is the FIRST AND LAST time we will order his dog food from Amazon, or online at all, after such a terrible experience. Soon after starting a new bag of food, our dog began to have diarrhea for several days. Then, he did not poop at all for 2 days. This had coincided with an overnight boarding, so, at the time, we had thought it had something to do with that. We had called the vet who had suggested we try to wait it out, in case it was something foreign he ingested that would work it's way through his system. Were about to take him to the animal hospital because we were so concerned, but then my husband suggested that perhaps it could be the food. I did not want to believe it. Amazon stands by their products as authentic, right? How could it be that?? Well, we purchased a new bag from the pet store and wouldn't you know it -- IT LOOKS COMPLETELY DIFFERENT. The pieces of food are a different size, shape and color. Not easily noticeable if you aren't looking for it, but now that I have, the difference is clear. I'm completely outraged. I don't know if this product is a knock-off, or if it's old, or outdated, or recalled, or what, but I won't be ordering it from Amazon again, that's for sure. I'll try to upload a photo comparison of the food later.

reviews.review_title: When a yellow lab wont even eat it, it must be bad!
reviews.review_text: I had seen the ads on TV for Blue Buffalo and I liked what they were promoting. I had been feeding my yellow lab Purina One dog food from the grocery store that cost about 1/3 as much as Blue Buffalo. Whenever I switch dog food I always slowly mix in the new food with the old so he gets adjusted to it gradually. At first he took right to it, but once he was served just the Blue Buffalo he refused to it! I had to entice him with people food. I bought a small bag of the Purina One I was feeding him and tried mixing the foods again. My yellow lab then proceeded to pick out the Blue Buffalo food and spit it on the floor and only eat the Purina One. I have never seen my dog turn down any kind of food until now. Back to Purina One for us.I would like to note, cost and shipping on Amazon's part was perfect and I have no complaints. My only complaint is with the Blue Buffalo Dog Food.

reviews.review_title: Huge bag with a flavor the dogs love
reviews.review_text: This. Bag. Is. HUGE!!When we saw this box on our doorstep, we had no idea what it was - maybe a table, huge cutting board, or a piece of furniture? As the owner of two small dogs, we had never gotten a really big bag of dog food before.Enter the Blue Buffalo mega bag! We felt like we were dog owners with a Saint Bernard when we opened up the box and saw this giant bag of fishery for the pups. The dogs had really been enjoying Natural Balance dry dog food that was fish and sweet potato flavor, but it was a little too pricey. We switched to Blue Buffalo gradually and the pups love it just as much, if not more!One of our dogs used to eat wet food, but he really loves Blue Buffalo products even more. It's been substantially easier for us and it's been a lot better for his teeth to eat dry dog food. The wet, raw food he had been eating was leading to a lot of tartar build up and we're really happy that we have him on a food that he likes that's good for his teeth. They've tried the Blue Buffalo chicken flavor as well, but I think the fish is where it's at.For our two dogs (9 lbs and 20 lbs), this mega bag will easily last us months! We love Blue Buffalo products!

reviews.review_title: Something has gone horribly wrong at Blue Buffalo
reviews.review_text: Up to November 2014 our dogs loved this food. Then suddenly one of them started leaving most of it in her bowl. The other would reluctantly finish. They both developed diarrhea and one started having problems controlling her bladder, urinating inside the house. Over the holidays, she refused to eat it at all and lost significant weight. A little internet research found numerous reports of similar symptoms by owners feeding Blue Buffalo. Evidently something changed in the fall of 2014.Luckily, our dogs' refusal to eat probably avoided significant health issues. We switched to Nutro and all of the issues disappeared within a week. Sorry Blue Buffalo, one bad experience is all you get. We will never feed your food to our pets again. Never.

I've had my puppy for a few months now, and he's been doing quite well on Purina. After visiting my dad over the weekend, he gave me a bag of this stuff because his dog wouldn't touch it. I went online and read the reviews, including a lot of the negative ones. I was skeptical, and held off on it for a little while. Then one afternoon, I was about to feed my dog before heading off to work when I realized we were pretty much out of dog food (I didn't realize earlier because my fiance and I alternate feeding the dog). I figured that there were so many positive reviews, it was most likely a few bizarre cases where dogs got sick, and it may have even been from something else. I gave him a scoop, and left for work. When I got home, all of my concerns were immediately validated. My dog had horrible diarrhea, was throwing up, and was extremely listless and shaking.If you read through the ingredients in this food, most of it really seems fine, but I can promise you that it's not. I don't know if it's due to some kind of product mishandling, or other unlisted ingredients, but there's a reason this stuff has so many bad reviews. I wish I had listened to the negative reviews, despite them being drastically outweighed by the positive ones. A quick Google search will show you some of the horrible things associated with this product - shakes, tremors, seizures, digestion issues, and in several cases death. You know it's a problem when an extremely hungry dog won't touch it. I'm not a dog expert. I've only had my dog for a few months, and I'm still learning a lot. I am by no means a dog food snob, and really only tried this overpriced dog poison because my father tried to do the right thing for his dog and bought him the "good" food. There's nothing wrong with the $13 bag of Purina puppy chow at the grocery store. Save your money and your dog's life.
SO FAR, DOGS SEEM TO LIKE IT.

reviews.review_title: Blue Buffalo Dry Food Fish and Sweet Potatoe
reviews.review_text: My Daisy loves eating Blue Buffalo every day. Blu Buffalo has alot of variety of meats, so my dog never gets bored.

I have two small dogs, 20lbs and 9lbs, they both love this food. The 30lbs bag last about 3-4months which is great for my wallet. This is also the only dog food that didn't cause one of my dogs a rash on his face.

My four dogs have never liked dry dog food until being introduced this particular Blue Life brand. They went to it like a pig would go to slop !! They have been eating it ever since. Also the small bites are great, not only for the two small ones but the two BIG DOGS LOVE IT TO! How do I know, They told me so! They use a form of sign language. It is a smile and a wagging tail!!!!

I guess like a lot of parents, my children have certain chores that they do to help out around the house.  One of my 4 year olds chores (that she actually loves to do) is feeding our dog.  One morning, she fed our dog his name-brand dog food and, mid-munching, our dog turned about and licked our daughter on the cheek.  My daughter immediately broke out in hives.My daughter has lots of food allergies, one of which is peanuts.  Imagine my horror when I looked at our name-brand dog food and realized peanuts were a main ingredient!  I always read food labels to keep my daughter safe, but it never occurred to me that I needed to check the dog's food.  I immediately set about trying to find a dog food that didn't have nuts.  I couldn't find one at our local big-box store.  I got on amazon and found Blue Buffalo!!Blue Buffalo, not only is great for my dog, but it's NUT FREE!  I can let my daughter feed our dog and not worry that she's going to have a severe allergic reaction!  I would buy it just because it's nut-free, but I've been so pleased with the quality of the food and the benefits to our dog as well.  Our dog eats less of this than he did of the name-brand dog food we were buying.  His coat seems shinier.  The *only* disappointment, which really isn't one, is that it didn't "cure" my dog's shedding.  (No, we didn't seriously think it would, but there's always wishful thinking.)We happily are repeat customers and this is the only dog food we'd get for our dog!

Fed this to my dog for about two years.She became incontinent.  Took her to the Vet, after many test they did a biopsy and sent her samples out to two different expertsincluding Rutgers University who contacted my vet and told her to tell us to stop feeding her whatever it was we were feeding her because that is what was causing her liver disease.Two weeks after that she had full liver failure and we had to put her to sleep.Never again.Turns out this company has had many recalls.  Just google blue buffalo and liver failure and you are going to be shocked.We now feed our dogs Health Extension.  This company has never had a recall.

reviews.review_title: Blue Buffalo changed my Cockapoo 's life!
reviews.review_text: My cockapoo used to eat Beneful ever since he was younger. He used to have bad skin, and every couple of times each month he would have seizures.Our old vet said this can be common because of his breed and/or it may be because of allergies; we changed to prescription food (rabbit was the main protein) and this did not work. We didnt think it was worth the money when there were no successful results and switched back to Beneful. This was bad in that it gave our dog severe diarrhea,  to the point where he couldn't hold it in and/or blood would squirting everywhere as well. We brought him to the vet many times and they couldn't find what was wrong with him.We researched then and  read online about how Beneful was horrible with dogs and gave them side effects such as dry skin and even seizures and we researched about blue buffalo before we bought it the first time (5 years ago). Since we switched and eased him into Blue Buffalo, he does not have as bad dry skin as before, and he has not had a seizure since (knock on wood)! He loves the food and we switch from flavor to flavor once un a while so he doesn't get bored with it. He has more energy too! We got others to switch to Blue Buffalo and their dogs love it too! It may be expensive but it's definitely worth it for our Cockapoo and we will never be switching to Beneful or any brand similar to them again.
My dog loves this. She is on here 3rd bag and she loves it. I add a little water to it and she really goes for it.

The delivery service is especially helpful for me, as I am disabled and can't put a 30 pound bag in my cart/car. When it arrives at my doorstep, I just ask a friend to bring it in - and also have a nice box for future use. Thanks, Amazon!

reviews.review_title: The best dog food out there hands down
reviews.review_text: Within a week my dogs coats were shinier and softer. We want our pups to be with us as long as they can and truly believe that feeding them the best will add years to their life.

Before feeding my dog food Blue Buffalo, I was buying regular kibble from the store with lots of fillers and it was not doing any favors for my cocker spaniel's skin allergies. I finally decided to upgrade to better quality food when my dog developed systemic lupoid oncodystrophy, a sloughing and breaking of the nails. She was losing a nail down to the quick every other week. A combination of this food and salmon oil worked amazing. She hasn't lost a single nail since we switched and she doesn't bite and scratch incessantly at her skin anymore. I'm a BB buyer for life. I feel so much better at feeding time when I know I'm giving her goodies to nourish her body. Worth it for the price.

reviews.review_title: Only food we feed our dogs
reviews.review_text: We were shocked to find that our young, then two year old CKC spaniel had high cholesterol.  Our vet said that it could be because of the lamb in the food he was eating at that time.  DH and I researched various brands of dog food and chose Blue Buffalo because of it's all natural ingredients, vitamins and amino acids.  Our dogs thrived with BB and the dog with high cholesterol got down to normal levels.  Blue Buffalo costs a lot more; but we love our dogs and it's a worthwhile investment to us.  The only drawback it that our dogs have fish breath.
My pup loves this dog food. She is very finicky about the food she eats, and keeps down... But with Blue Buffalo she seems to do better.

reviews.review_title: My 3 Dogs Won't Touch this Food
reviews.review_text: I couldn't get to the vet and buy the prescription WD before I was going to run out with my work schedule, so I read all the great reviews and thought this would be great for my dogs. I have one dog with diabetes, so I have to feed her what works well for her, too. She is voracious and will eat anything. I got this food and my two dogs refused to eat it for 3 days. My dog with diabetes ate it and had diarrhea. I've gotten food before that they didn't like, but I put it outside for the homeless animals to eat, too, so it wasn't a complete loss. The next day, they hardly touched it! I usually put out Purina food for all of the homeless animals. Something is seriously wrong with this food that the starving homeless animals won't eat it and my dogs would rather not eat anything at all than eat this. I finally got them eating again by cooking brown rice and getting their regular food, mixed with Beneful wet dog food. I won't speculate what's wrong with it, but I will probably wind up throwing this new bag in the trash. I hate wasting money and food like that, but their health is more important.

reviews.review_title: My pups tell me they love it
reviews.review_text: I have used this product for quite a while already.  You seem to be holding the price as well including free shipping.  I like not having to drive a distance to get it, then wrestle from the car to the closet.

Word of caution. My dog has been on BB food for 5 years. I've used all types, chicken, lamb, fish. I had recently switched to fish and potato as she had developed a skin allergy to chicken. The fish mix straightened her out. She was on it for three months, until a few days ago, when she had an OD reaction to the vitamin supliment in the food. How do I know? Simple. BB consists of two types of kibble, the triangular meat and vegetable portion and a dark round supplemental nugget portion. The ratio of one to the other is usually something like 95% to 5% meat kibble to supplemental nugget. This bag consisted of more than 60% supplemental nugget. I should have known  better but I trusted BB to not let a bad mix out of the factory. My dog had a toxic reaction - heavy salivating, drooling, discomfort - a few hours after dinner. I returned the bag of fish and potato and picked up a bag of BB lamb and rice. Before walking out of the store I opened the bag and checked the ratio. Looked normal. fed it to dog. No problems. So, bottom line, check the ration of the kibble in the bag before feeding to your dog, and don't trust Blue Buffalo to own up to the problem and initiate a recall.

I have a chocolate lab.  We carefully monitor his diet because labs LOVE to eat.  We used Iams lamb and rice formula from the time he was a puppy.  He was itchy, had frequent ear infections and even on the low end of the recommended amount of food for weight, he gained weight.  So after reading the reviews, decided to try Blue Buffalo Lamb and Rice about three months ago.  Jakes's skin and coat are much healthier, no longer scratching.  Even at the maximum amount of food for his weight he has slowly lost weight and is at the weight he should be now (lost about 9 lbs).  He has had no ear infections and his ears stay nice and clear!  Jake loves the flavor! The only downshot I have is that the food size is not optimal for a large dog.I like buying from Amazon.  We have a Prime membership so shipping isn't an issue.  It comes to my door, cost is the same as the local big box pet store.

My dogs eat nothing else.  And, I've told friends about this great food and they have told me they could actually see an imporvement in their own dogs over a couple of months.  The dogs maintain a constant healthy weight while regulating their own food intake.  They are healthy, active and I think Blue is the best food to maintain their good health.

reviews.review_title: Blue Buffalo Dry Dog Food, Lamb and Rice Recipe Dog Food
reviews.review_text: What can I say, I've done the research and IMHO, Blue Buffalo is the best brand of Dog Food available.  My dog has thrived on it for three years now.  We started him off on Pedigree as recommended by the kennel but he got sick from the food.  We nursed him back to health.  I sent a sample of the old food to Pedigree and they found nothing wrong with it.  I then did my research and have been using Blue Buffalo ever since.  Max's coat is shiny, he's full of life, and has not been sick a day since.

My dogs really like this food. I know this is gross but I noticed that when we switched to this food from IAMS SmartPuppy, their poo got a lot more...shall we say...fragrant. Like, they could poo on the other side of the yard from me and I could still smell it. It was bad. Really bad. Over time, the "situation" has improved somewhat. And after all, it's not supposed to smell great coming out the other end anyway, right? I just noticed a marked difference from their old food. Some of that could be just the switch from puppy to adult food though. I don't know for sure, but just thought I would throw it out there as a word of caution.I have heard a lot of great things about Blue Buffalo and how good it is for dogs. I don't know how true that is, but my dogs are happy and healthy, so I don't see myself changing brands anytime soon.

reviews.review_title: BEWARE OF "IN STOCK" AND SHIPPING DATES
reviews.review_text: I love the dog food, and it deserves 5 stars no doubt. My female pitt  has been on it since she was a puppy. I noticed it was cheaper on Amazon then in my typical pet store so I ordered 2 bags on what was shown to be eligible for prime. I was out of town and my dog was running low on food anyway so I decided having it shipped to the house for the sitter would be the best option.When I checked out it only offered 3-5 day shipping, I called amazon and the woman apologized saying it was an error on their end, but the woman at customer support assured me I would get the food within 3-5 days (considering my dog was already low to begin with). It is now day 3 and my dog food is still marked as "not shippoed" and the estimated delivery date is May 8th - May 27th? WHAT! I called Amazon customer support AGAIN and the story was different! The new woman said the item really "is not in stock but shows it is in stock because it is shipping from a third party seller that advertises on their website". After that I ask why the option of 3-5 days as a shipping speed comes up and how nit was still not shipped, while the other person I spoke to 3 days ago told me it would come. The woman then says "shipping speed and shipping date are different," and that "if you (I) reviewed your (my) order you (I) would see it wasn't going to come." Excuse me Amazon for assuming shipping speed was related to shipping, long story short the lady had no remorse that I was over 3,000 miles away and my dog was going to run out of food. I told them to cancel my order since getting the dog food TWO MONTHS FROM NOW was not going to help my dog!!!
Quite a bit.  I use this with my Italian Greyhound so she can nibble on something once her can dog food.

reviews.review_title: Only choice for my chocolate lab!
reviews.review_text: I've been feeding my 9 year old chocolate lab this food for about a year now and have really noticed a positive difference. His coat is beautiful, and I get comments on it all the time. This is the best price I've found for this food, with the fastest shipping. I find I need to feed him less, and he looks great. I love my dog, and would happily pay a little extra for food to keep him healthy and happy. Thanks Blue Buffalo.

My dog loves it, her poo is easy to pick up and I can tell it doesn't upset her stomach like some of the cheaper foods.  She even has a problem with some of the other flavors in this brand, but never had a problem with the fish and sweet potato.
Wow! healthy. This food pepped up my 10 year old dog and he is full of energy now. Expensive, but my English Setters are worth every penny. Also try the canned dog food.

reviews.review_title: My picky dog loves this flavor
reviews.review_text: I've always used the Blue dry food for my schnauzer. I used to buy the chicken flavor but he'd only eat it when he was REALLY hungry. After changing up the flavor to lamb, he actually eats right as I pour into his bowl! Wish the food isn't so expensive but it IS better than many of the generic brands out there and I want my dog to be as healthy as possible.

We were trying to find a high quality dog food that was a little cheaper then the normal food we buy Taste of the Wild. I have two dogs. One who can't eat many things and one who can eat everything. Ironically, the one who can eat everything pukes this food up. My other dog can tolerate about half her food being the Buffalo but any more then that and her stool becomes watery. We don't have a lot of money to be wasting an expensive bag of food so we add a little every day.I was talking to my mom about this and she said that this was the food she bought for our dogs when we were away. She happened to be watching my brothers dogs as well, and of course she had her own.  All five dogs got diarrhea from this food. It could be the dogs as my brothers dogs are siblings to mine, however, her dog is not related and also got sick.I am going back to Taste of The Wild.
The dogs seem to like it okay, but the kibble is very tiny and not helping clean their teeth. All my dogs are 8 to 18 pounds.

Our dogs love this food. The size of the kibbles makes it easy for our 15 pound dog to chew and our 50 pound dog yums it up!  It is high quality and I have noticed that our dogs coats look shiny and beautiful as a result.

reviews.review_title: Glad we switched to Blue Buffalo
reviews.review_text: We were having some problems with both dogs vomiting and suspected a food allergy. We switched to Blue Buffalo Lamb and Rice. No more vomiting, they are more energetic and much healthier. Rufus our Black Lab looks great since the switch to this food. His coat is super shiny, eyes are much brighter and he has more energy. I also give him and Sadi the Blue Buffalo treats. They don't seem to eat as much as they did eating the other food they were on. We won't buy any other food for them.

Switched to Blue Buffalo because it is made in the USA and because our dog was getting sick about every four months on her old food. Since the switch (1 yr ago) she has not had a problem and has more energy. Ordering through Amazon as a great deal too!

If you want a food that will do the following then get this brand:1. Lessen bad breath2. Reduce shedding3. Increase longevity4. Increase vitality5. Make your pets eat less6. Less poo7. Costs the same as junk brands....seriously. They eat less.Don't believe it? Try it for one month. You'll see. My dogs have been on this almost 6 years not and I will NEVER feed anything but this.
Expensive dog food. I guess this stuff works fine. My dog died of cancer so it's hard to say a really good comment on dog foods.

I HIGHLY recommend this brand of dog food.  My vet said this is a great brand and healthy for your pet. I bought the Weight Control formula to help keep her weight within the normal range.  Although a little pricey, the 30lb bag lasts a very long time.  It has portion instructions on the bag which are very helpful.  The vitamins in this are cold pressed to preserve the nutrients unlike other brands that use heat and therefore lose nutrients.  Pets are worth the price.
very good. my dogs liked it. Seems to help with itching and scratching. they seem a lot more comfortable now.

reviews.review_title: BLUE BUFFALO Made my dog very sick!
reviews.review_text: I have a 3 yr old Austrailian Shepherd we got from a breeder at 9 weeks.  From birth he's been on Pro Plan Purina dog food.  Our neighbor, who's dog is our Aussies play mate, had been encouraging us to switch to Blue.  After reading the packaging, we thought it sounds great, it's more expensive-so it must be better.  1 week later our dog has had non-stop 36 hour diarrhea.  Drinking endless water.  Night and day, non stop.  2 vet trips later, steriod shot, antibiotics, probiotics, warm compresses and neosporin, we are praying for him to recover.  Yesterday we through away the expensive Blue and bought a bag of the Pro Plan. With white rice and his normal scoop, today we saw his stool firming up again.  Our dog does not have a sensative stomach at all.  He has counter surfed as a puppy and ate many many things.  That is not the case here, the Blue Dog food has caused such diarrhea that his rear end is severly inflammed, he walks sideways and runs from his back end.  He drags and sits on his bottom refusing to walk.  DONT DO IT, something in this food will make your dog sit.  Read the consumer affairs report.  Same symptoms with over 500 other dogs.
High quality food. My dog really likes it. I'm glad it is good for her long term health and fitness.
Transitioned by dog over to this food in December. He took to it right away. We are about half a bag in and so far so good.

Blue Buffalo makes an excellent product and with the help of Amazon Prime I can have it delivered to my door for the same price as a local store.  Perhaps this is the wave of the future, no local stores, a strong UPS plus home delivery and all the wealth concentrated in huge monopolies?

We started feeding this to Skip, and he liked it so much he would eat them for treats.10 months later I adopted another dog "Moku" that was the beginning of the trouble.Moku would barely eat enough to stay alive, then he had flatulence, and belching, and occasionally yellow colored diareah.I put both dogs on Natural Ballance Lamb and Rice, and both love the food and no more stomach problems

So, like most people who are willing to buy an extremely expensive dog food, I thought this product would help my dog lose some weight and be healthier for her in the long run. She had been eating Purina Dog Chow since she was a year old and I thought it was time for a switch since she is a little heavier than I would like her to be. I bought this product about 1 1/2 weeks ago and weaned her off of the Purina after 1 week. Now that the Blue is the only thing in her bowl, she refuses to eat it. I have been mixing less than a spoonful of canned food to get her to eat it, but she still will not finish it. I have not noticed any gastrointestinal distress as others have had problems with, but honestly, I have not been paying that much attention to her stool. I certainly will be now, though. If she continues on this dog food, she definitely will lose weight, but only because she's not eating it, which of course, is absolutely unacceptable. I have no idea how I'm going to finish this bag of food for this one little dog, but I certainly was disappointed that my dog didn't like it and that it was so expensive. I know that Purina makes a Healthy Weight dog food that, in the case of my parents' dogs, is very palatable and has helped their obese beagle shed over 5 lbs, though in all honesty, his success was due mostly to being on a controlled diet instead of getting fed free-choice or just a "scoop" of food whenever he was hungry.

We ended up switching to Blue Buffalo due to one of my dogs skin rash on his face. It was so itchy that it was raw at one point. We did try other food but nothing seem to help, we gave Blue a try and after feeding it to him for a month or two we started to see a difference in is rash. His sick was less red and the rash was going away. We have been feeding him Blue for almost 4 years now and he hasn't had any reaction towards it at all.

reviews.review_title: My dog has not stopped farting
reviews.review_text: I HATE THIS DOG FOOD! My dog has not stopped farting! The vet thought she might have an allergy so I switched her to this to test it out. She loves the food and I'm sure its all great and healthy for her but I don't see the need for expensive and fancy dog food, especially when she still eats trash and other foreign objects.

When I first adopted my little dachshund, her previous owner fed her a just any old grocery store dog food because she didn't realize there was a difference.  Sassy had dandruff and her coat was dull and listless.  After a few months on Blue Buffalo, Sassy's coat is now free of dandruff and her black coat shines and glistens like polished coal.  Oh, and she's HEALTHY, too!
My Boxer Bull Mastiff loves his lamb and rice Blue Buffalo food.  How do I know...there is never anything left in his bowl twice a day.
My dog loves this food. I like that it is healthier for her than the cheaper brands. I also love the convenience of ordering it and having it shipped to my door free (with prime).

reviews.review_title: Good product despite being large and mass-produced
reviews.review_text: I vary my dog's food every bag and notice a significant difference in energy levels, stool consistency, and shedding and dander. My dog is also a picky eater so taste plays a role as well. Here's my experience:Quality: it does seem like a high quality product with good ingredientsStool: soft and medium amountShedding: some shedding and dander, shiny coatTaste: he likes the taste of this oneEnergy level: high
This is the brand our dog has been on since she was a pup. No problems. Great product. I won't change foods on her as this is a good one.

reviews.review_title: Blue Buffalo Dry Dog Food, Fish and Sweet Potato Recipe, 30-Pound Bag
reviews.review_text: MY DOGS LOVE BLUE BUFFALO DOG FOOD. The fish and sweet potato flavor of blue buffalo dog food is very nutritional as well as taste appealing to my dogs. blue buffalo fish and sweet potato dog food has no corn, wheat, or soy.

We had our miniture Doxie on this food when he was a pup but he had awful breath and gas. We have had him on a big name bad ingredient food for quite a while and we are just unhappy with the ingredients. We have recently switched him back and are expecting and hoping for good things. When he was on this food before he has the most shiny coat! Here's to hoping.
My dog seems to enjoy this food.  She has very bad allergies but I can tell a huge difference once I switched to this food.  It's very expensive, but you can't put a price on happiness.
Great product and very healthy for dog Tony. Also the two cats Charlie and Rosie love it too. Vet says this is ' the good stuff '

reviews.review_title: Healthy dog food that dogs like!
reviews.review_text: My dog loved the product & because I lived on a ranch in a remote area without major shopping stores I could only buy it via the internet.  We have now retired & moved closer to a major city with access to stores that carry the brand.
I can buy the 17 lb bag for little more cost locally.  Otherwise the food is best choice for dog.

This food was recommended to us for its high quality ingredients and lamb protein. My dog had allergies to chicken based foods before this.  The allergies went away with this food, with one additional side effect.  Really bad gas! I was bad enough that we had to abandon half a bag, and move to hydrolized protein food.  You might want to ask your vet for a sample before committing.  Sometimes they have small sample bags.  After mentioning the problem with some other dog owners I heard some similar stories concerning lamb foods in general.  Finding a compatible dog food is much harder than I thought.
After $100's of dollars in vet bills, found out my dogs got really sick from eating Blue Buffalo. Do a review search on their product before you start feeding it.

A few months ago, Joey who is now 1 ½ yrs old, had crystals in his urine. Assuming that it was because of him being a puppy, his hygiene wasn’t the best. Was put on antibiotics and Hills food for 10 days. The crystals cleared up. Then on Oct 17th of this years, he developed severe diarrhea and was vomiting. I gave him an Imodium and withheld food that night. The Next morning I fed him a small amount of food and within 15 mins. he threw that up too.  We were out of town at the time, so I had to take him to a vet I knew nothing about. Luckily Brewer Vets in Springfield, IL were great. I immediately had them do an xray because this is a dog that was known to swallow rocks and it was the exact same symptoms. Xray showed he had several pockets of gas in his stomach and intestines. All his blood work and vitals were normal. The vet thought that maybe the stress from traveling caused it. Although we were only 2 ½ hrs. from home and Joey had slept the entire way there. Joey stayed at the vets for the day to make sure he did not become more dehydrated, then started him on Flygal and Hills food for 5 days. After a few days of this I put him back on BB. The diarrhea did not clear up and he was vomiting yellow phlegm in the morning about every 1 or 2 days.At the same time that all this started with Joey, Frankie, who is 10 yrs., started drinking water excessively and peeing a lot. Took another stool sample of Joey’s and a urine sample of Frankie’s to my vets about 4 days later. Joey’s stool sample was negative and Frankie’s urine showed a very high PH count. Joey had also started drinking large amounts of water. More lab work done on Joey and also on Frankie. Both came back normal. We thought that maybe Joey had become allergic to chicken, so I bought a bag of BB fish & potato. Another 10 day round of Flygal and Hills food for 3 or 4 days for Joey and antibiotics for Frankie. After 2 weeks, Frankie had crystals in his urine and Joey still had Diarrhea. My vet put Frankie on a different antibiotic and Hills food for 2 weeks. Frankie has always gone to the bathroom 4 to 6 times a day and at least 1 time would be a soft stool. After 2 or 3 days on the Hills food, Frankie stopped drinking as much and going to the bathroom as often, and not one was diarrhea. Kind of made the light bulb go off.  Frankie’s urine sample yesterday still shows his PH is high but the crystals are gone. Started reading all the reviews about Blue Buffalo and was amazed at how many dogs had the same symptoms as Joey and Frankie. Switched all 4 of my dogs to Wellness dog food….no chicken in it either. Within 2 days Joey’s stools were almost normal again. 3 dogs I switched over cold turkey and Joey in 1 ½ days. Not 1 of them even had soft stools from switching so fast.Both Joey and Ranger, 1 of my other dogs kept licking and chewing their butt every time they went to the bathroom. This stopped after switching food too.At the time all this started, both Joey and Ranger were only getting ¾ cup of BB. In the morning they got raw chicken backs and freeze dried raw food. At night they got BB and ¾ cup freeze dried raw. I don’t even want to think what might have happened to Joey if he had eaten only BB. Frankie and Leeah were getting straight BB. Lucky for me Leeah never got sick since she is 12 yrs old and wouldn’t have bounced back as fast as Joey.It’s too bad that Blue Buffalo doesn’t spend some of their money on trying to figure out what’s wrong with their food instead of so much on advertising trying to convince people how good their dog food is. Even better, maybe they could pay my vet bills which, at this point, amount to hundreds of dollars. I had been using BB for almost 2 yrs. and you can bet I’ll NEVER use it again. There are several sites on the web with bad reviews for BB and I’m going to try to post this to as many as I can find.

Blue Buffalo has such a good reputation that I decided to switch to it for my male dachshund.  He was almost hairless on his chest area, and after a few weeks on the Blue Buffalo his hair grew in; I didn't even know he should have had such a nice coat!  He does tend to spit out the little "LifeSource Bits" nutrition pieces in the mix, but will eventually eat them if he gets hungry enough.  He has never looked better.
Blue is a great dog food contains everything they need to maintain good coats and weight.a little expensive but worth it
Very expensive and it gave my dog the runs. After speaking to my vet she recommended Beneful which is much less expensive, my dog loves it, and has lost weight eating it.

One of my two dogs, an elderly (almost 14 year old) Blue Heeler rescue, was having terrible problems with her skin.  I started her on this and the results were remarkable..her itching stopped, her weight came down to normal (she had been getting dumpy on her former food) and her coat and energy level are much improved.  She obviously feels very good on this, is back to her old cheerful self, and clearly likes the taste as well.

This food bag is larger than the largest carried by Petsmart and is cheaper to boot!  My dog has a wheat allergy and this blend gives him no problems at all.  I would say it tastes great, but I haven't tried it and my dog can't speak.  He seems to really enjoy it though.
My dog (17 pound Cockapoo) seems to enjoy this brand of food very much. I've never seen her get sick from it. She had been eating this food for about 2 years.

reviews.review_title: Great dogfood and a good price
reviews.review_text: Delivers quickly and the price cannot be beat. Dogs love this food and we have been feeding this brand to our dogs for years and they are healthy with shiny coats.
I have to do a mix of wet and dry food, and this seems to be the best for the dry.  It doesn't upset my dog's stomach and the bites are good for my small and medium dog.

Wow! So far so good..I placed this order on Oct. 2nd & it arrived on Oct. 4th. My dog is usually very finicky. Upon sniffing her new dog she immediately started chowing down! Now if the excessive shedding & dry skin subsides (as some have posted)......

reviews.review_title: Great Food - Our Veterinarian Recommended It
reviews.review_text: Our veterinarian recommended Blue Buffalo. We have a very itchy corgi mix and was hoping this food would help. He had been on several medications with no real relief. We originally switched from Iams premium protection to the lamb and rice variety. It just seemed to make his itchiness worse. After a few months we tried this kind. It does have a strong fish smell, but like others have said that is to be expected. All three of our dogs really like it and don't hesitate to eat it day after day. It seems to have helped with the itching, but it did something even better - our old cocker mix has urinated in the house on and off for years. We have seen the vet and tried medications that didn't seem to fix the problem. Once she had been on this food for a few months the urinating has stopped. She's been on it for almost two years.
Great thing about this is that it arrives on my door step.  Only wish that they had the oatmeal and lamb variety that is for adults.

Food arrived as described and promptly. Normally I would have to go to the pet store and lug these bags around; but, this time I decided to try ordering it from Amazon. The price was comparable and with prime shipping, I didn't think I could pass this trial up. It definitely was the way to go, and I would do it again.

I have a one year old yellow lab named Lola that has been eating Blue Buffalo since the day I got her at age 3mos. She was on the Puppy dry food and I am now feeding her the Adult Fish/Sweet Potato recipe. She is VERY active and I truly believe she is as healthy as she is due to eating Blue Buffalo. Her coat is thick and shiny. Her gums are healthy and her teeth are SO white! It is expensive, however where I buy her food from (Petco Unleashed in MA) if you have a rewards card with them the more you spend they so send you lots of coupons which is great!

Great price for this dog food and it saved me a trip to the store. In my town, there is only one store that sells blue buffalo, and it is always a pain for me to get there before they close after work. With Amazon Prime, I can't beat it. I will be ordering again.

Blue Buffalo Dry Dog Food, is the best thing that has ever happened to us and Sam.Now our Sam eats on a regular schedule and we don't have to give him snacks or treats all the time and now he has one treat a day at 3pm, totally satisfied. Quality of life for us: excellent. Quality of Life for Dogs: excellent.  everyone is happy.This was a dog that wouldn't eat any of the dog food's (all brands) we tried over the last four  and a half years (he is 4 years old) the weird thing was the weight gain (chewies and snacks)? Now he is losing weight and his coat is shiny and healthy, and Babe our 10 year old lab is healthy and energetic etc (Babe always ate the food we purchased for Sam) but she really loves Blue.My sister Liz is the one that told us about Blue......thank you Liz and Amazon......
This product seems to be a good product.  My dog is very picky.  He did like it at first, but on the second week I had to mix it with some homemade sauce for him to eat it ALL.
My dogs love this food.  They eat every morsel.  It is great  buying on line but its a little pricey.  I would buy again and recommend to my friends
Blue is the best food for my dogs.  they love it and it treats them great.  cant beat getting dog food delivered to your door.

reviews.review_title: Once again, the BEST for my dogs!
reviews.review_text: I put my life on the line with this food. Hands down it is the ABSOLUTE BEST dog food out there FOR MY DOGS. Not everyone will agree as each dog is different. No fillers, sawdust, BHA, BHT, sugar, rendered "meat", etc. I can always tell when a dog is eating bad food, especially SD dogs. They are fat, shed, bad breath and have really bad dander. I can't believe people don't read the labels on SD....corn, sawdust, by-products, rendered meat which means the 4-Ds: Dead, Dying, Dieased, Disabled. Don't believe me? Do your homework.

This dog food is one of the best with regards to minimized allergens, natural ingredients, protein content, and vitamin and mineral content. It is a little bit more expensive than some but you definitely pay for good quality.

This food smells so fresh!  I have 3 dogs; an English Mastiff, a blue heeler, and a german shepherd,  The mastiff had some minor weight issues and she has toned up and gained more muscle since eating this food.  My other dogs are doing great on it as well.  No more throwing up and gassiness.  The dogs would do that at times when eating the poorer quality food.  I feel better knowing my dogs are getting top notch nutrition and taste!  Just buy this dog food!  It is great!
My three dogs just love this food !  I wanted them to eat something that could keep their weight down and also be healthy, Blue Buffalo was the right choice.

My dogs, love the Blue Buffalo food and I love that they love it.  Seriously, my little guy used to have horrible stomach problems from other brands but this brand works well...and none of them have any gas!  That's worth the price, right there!

We adopted 2 five year old dogs last Labor Day weekend.  Finding food they both like has been trial and error.  We wanted to give them healthier food than the typical mass produced products.  So we went with Blue Buffalo.  Both dogs seem to love it.  Which is great since we got the 30# bag.  The service was perfect.  I was given a window of delivery dates and it arrived sooner than expected.  Once our dogs finish this bag, I'm sure we'll be going back for a different "flavor".

reviews.review_title: Worked wonders for a picky shih tzu
reviews.review_text: My dog (male, shih tzu, 12.5 pounds) is a very picky eater with a very sensitive stomach. Had tried some previous foods that were highly recommended but he either did not like them at all and/or he still had regular soft/loose stools. Got this, he likes it (although still "grazes" all day instead of eats everything once I give it to him)  and within a couple of weeks his stool was totally solid.

I have a big, high energy, Airedale Terrier.  I'd seen and heard a lot about Blue Buffalo so I thought I'd try it with my dog.  It was anything but a positive experience.  I very carefully transitioned him to the Chicken & Brown Rice dry food (he'd been on Pro Plan Sport which is also chicken) and while he seemed to like it (though I'm not sure there is any food he wouldn't like) the results were that he developed unbearable gas (unbearable to his family) that was pretty much 24X7.  But worse than than, he began to eat his own feces!  Literally right after he'd produce it.Needless to say I transitioned him back to Pro Plan, which we were not unhappy with anyway.  Both problems stopped.  Bottom-line, I would never recommend this food.

I have to say i bought this product for years and one day my two fox terriers were itching so bad I could not believe it. My girl dog was itching until she was bleeding. When I bought this product it was because our dogs were allergic to poultry. I read the ingredients and no chicken or turkey products and even called the company to see if it contained hidden poultry products and they said it was free of them then. When I went back into the store to read the ingredients again after years there it was TURKEY and they did not even warn the public if they were going to change the product. I called the company and asked why and they said they just changed the product and said they were sorry. Sorry does not help our dogs and they call themselves animal lovers........Never again Blue Buffalo I just can't' trust your company......

reviews.author_name: Lisa Steele of Fresh Eggs Daily
reviews.review_title: A big hit with our corgi and German shepherd
reviews.review_text: Our dogs both love this food.  They will eat it dry without having to be bribed to eat it by adding meat scraps, cheese or eggs to it.  They are both a great weight and have nice thick shiny coats. It's expensive but well worth the added cost.(We have a two-year old sheperd and a two-year old corgi)LisaFresh Eggs Dailywww.fresh-eggs-daily.com
We have used other grocery store brands and our dogs had dry skin and were very nervous.  We switched over to this dog food, the dogs really like it, their skin is no longer dry

I purchased a new bag of Blue Buffalo Life Protection Forumla and had major issues ! I had transitioned my 4 dogs slowly and feed them Blue for FOUR months - but the last bag appearred to have smaller size kibble and was darker in color. Eventually all of my dogs got Clostridial (food poisoning). They had severe diarreah. My vet said he has seen several cases of this related to Blue - BEWARE !!

This seems to be the only food my dog tolerates well, and of course she also loved it. This is all we've ever fed her (she's now 3) as it was recommended by the breeder. The only complaint is the price, which is high for dog food.
weight control and diabetic dogs, or dogs with digestive issues. I highly recommend it for all dogs except puppies. Excellent!
My dog loves Blue Buffalo, she is very active and just the right weight, won't use any other food. I like to mix flavors.

i want this rating of 1 becaise there is no 0  i order this on the 10 of march and still no order. wrote to them and no reply all other orders from other sellers are here no sure if my dog like the food

reviews.review_title: Best food for a PICKY dog!
reviews.review_text: I have a 1 year old Pug, Dexter, that is a VERY picky eater! We have tried numerous brands of dog food, but Dexter turned his nose up and refused to eat more often than not. My husband and I had made a game out of meal time, hand feeding Dexter one piece of food at a time while telling him what a "good boy" he was with every bite that he ate! As you can imagine, meal time with Dexter was EXHAUSTING!Thank goodness Petco recommended that we try Blue Buffalo Fish and Sweet Potato Recipe! We were THRILLED when we put Dexter's food bowl down and he immediately dug in! He never came up for air, eating every bite of the Fish and Sweet Potato recipe! We have been feeding Dexter the Fish and Sweet Potato recipe for 6 weeks now and he still loves it! THANK YOU BLUE BUFFALO!

Both dogs in my house lab/aussie shepherd mix and pomeranian/chihuahua refuse to eat this dogfood. They don't like it. I have half a bag left and it sucks that I need to buy a different brand. This may be healthy, but it tastes like crap apparently.

reviews.review_title: sick dog from Blue Buffalo Food
reviews.review_text: Our Collie/Shep mix was perfectly healthy before we switched him to Blue Buffalo ,he started having a weird retching after each meal.We had the food mixed with his normal ( Kirkland Nature's domain) food which he had tolerated very well for more than a year but he was getting a bit chunky ,hence the chance to a" very high quality dog food".Sometimes slime would come up and a little vomit, his stools got pretty smelly and light in color,not yet runny...We'll feed him a month of home made good organic food and than go back to former Kirkland Brand ,hope he'll get better soon.

While Homer and others think it's fine that the product page is lying and that on some other planet this 6lb bag of dog food is $52, but you are getting it for $35 dollars off at a mere $17, don't be fooled. In 2 years, they still haven't corrected this page. I buy Blue Buffalo for my dog, and it's great product. However, $52 is the price I pay for the 30lb. bag, not the 6lb one. When I saw this price I thought that "Oh, this must be discontinued at that price! Maybe I'll buy one! Oh wait....wtf?"So Blue Buffalo is great product for your dog.....you are NOT saving $35 on this bag.

My Akita is a very picky eater, this is the only food he seems to enjoy, I always get a clean plate from him when I serve him this food, I tried other Blue Buffalo recipes but he hates the other flavors, plus they make him very sick he gets a lot of diarrhea when I stop giving him the lamb recipe, once I continue to give him the lamb recipe his stomach goes back to normal

My Akita is a very picky eater, this is the only food he seems to enjoy, I always get a clean plate from him when I serve him this food, I tried other Blue Buffalo recipes but he hates the other flavors, plus they make him very sick he gets a lot of diarrhea when I stop giving him the lamb recipe, once I continue to give him the lamb recipe his stomach goes back to normal

At least in my book. I mix the dry food with some wet and both dogs polish everything off in no time. This formula is very pricy and no longer sold by Amazon. Therefore no free shipping and I can buy it for less at my local pet store.

reviews.review_title: It was great until the price increased...
reviews.review_text: I got my dog from a rescue group and they were feeding him another brand, I can't remember the name.  I did some research and decided on this brand.  It was the same price as the store and delivered to my door so I was thrilled about that.  My dog liked it, I don't know if thats saying much as he seems to want to eat just about anything, but I did notice that he didn't have that dog odor as strongly.I was pretty happy with it until my dog started getting sick. I can't say if it was his food or not.  The vet recommended I supplement his food with probiotics.  Then price on amazon got higher, I also read that they had changed the recipe and ultimately decided to change food.I saw that they carried a new brand called Hi-Tek that included pre and probiotics which was the same price as the blue buffalo used to be and changed to that.  He loved that, too, (you know, because he is so hard to please..).  He has been on that for a year and he has not gotten sick since. Again, I don't know if that is due to the food but considering the cost and convenience, I am prefer the Hi-Tek brand.  I wish they carried that as a subscribe and save.

I like this dog food, and so do my dogs. Sure its not cheap, but when it comes to my dogs only the best will do. Sure i've been known to cut a corner or two , but not when it comes to feeding my dogs!! sure you will like it to. Thanks  Pitbullman

My precious dog loves this flavor of Blue Buffalo and he only eats the dry food in this brand. No problem eating this food as long as he has his lamb. Blue Buffalo may be higher priced then most dry dog foods but I feel I am giving him high quality dog food and you can't put a price on that for my very best friend.

We started using BB food when we first got our beagle puppy and the vet recommended this variety as opposed to the Science Diet that was all over his shop.  That was 16 years ago this December (2012) and our beagle (and other dogs) are still going strong with no health issues!  She's 16, with no eye issues, weight problems, or any other known issues.The waste is controllable in the back yard and much easier than lesser foods since most of the food is high quality and digestible (unlike a lot of other foods, even some of the high dollar brands)...It's the brand that we always recommend and it's worth the money.  All of the varieties are high quality and our dogs have like them all...
My dog loves this food and I'm happy feeding her healthy food. She gets Blue Buffalo mixed with homemade food and she is in dog food bliss.

I have a super picky husky and this is the only food he will eat in a healthy amount. IT's good for the dog and while it's more expensive then most it really is the highest quality national brand in my opinion.

This a great dog food. My dog's groomer actually recommended it after she noticed a bunch of skin tags on my cocker spaniel's skin.  The vet said it's just due to old age and not to worry about them, but she said she has seen them due to an allergy to corn/wheat.  It took about a month, but they are now almost completely gone and her coat is super shiny.  I give it 4 stars because it's so expensive.  If it was about $10 cheaper, it'd be 5 stars.

Changed the ingredients from Fish meal to Turkey meal.  If you have a dog allergic to Chicken, he/she may also be allergic to ALL poultry.  They changed the ingredients.  NOW, I understand why my dog is biting and chewing at his paws again. He is also shedding again like a beast....  I did notice this but was confident that NONE of his food or treats had any poultry.  WELL, guess I need to read the bags every time I buy it.

reviews.review_title: Blue Buffalo is wonderful dog food
reviews.review_text: Love this dog food for my lab. No corn or other fillers, great vegetables and fruits with healthy meat protein for the dog. Highly reccomend this for your pet.

reviews.review_title: First day use, can tell difference
reviews.review_text: Usually after feeding cup of her regular food, science diet, she is whiny and wants more.  After this morning's feed, happy girl, content.For the most part I have made her food, but during busy times, resorted to dry food and what I thought was good quality. She never seemed full on the dry I was giving her during busy times when I could not make her food. Depending on how she does over the next couple of weeks, may stop making her food.

My Scottish Terrier was eating varietals of Blue Buffalo for 6 months+ with no problem. Suddenly she began vomiting and having bloody diarrhea. The Vets recommended a 24 hour fast with a pure chicken and rice diet for a few days. Problem solved. She was back to normal. I integrated the Blue Buffalo back into her diet and the bloody diarrhea started again. Another visit to vet and a more detailed discussion about her diet... the vet's response: " Oh yeah, we get a lot of cases of that with Blue Buffalo. "She was fine as soon as I took her off of it 2 months ago and has been totally normal since.I will never recommend or buy this product again.

reviews.review_title: Great food, my dogs love it
reviews.review_text: I tried Blue Buffalo on the recomendation of an agent when I adopted my rescue. I never thought that a premium food would make such a difference though. The ingredients are pretty straight forward and the more I learned about how dog food is made the more amazed I was a BB for how they make their foods. For one I love the fact that I feed about half of what I would feed my dogs using normal dry foods, which makes the bag last twice as long. Also I can tell the difference in their health, they are more active and having a sheltie with a sensitive stomach I was amazed at how dramatic the decrease in incidents related to his digestive problem we had. As a fact, since I switched we have only had 2 this year (mainly because someone didn't follow the no table scraps rule) where with other regular and even higher end foods we had issues once or twice a week even if he did not get anything outside of his regular kibble.

reviews.review_title: Excellent Product and Prime Shipping from Amazon
reviews.review_text: I mixed my dog's old food with BB Fish & Sweet Potato-50/50-to allow his system to adjust. I chose the small size bites after I read a review by another customer. My big dog prefers larger crunchies so next time, I will buy BB with large size kibble for Max.
My picky eater loves Blue Buffalo. She initially started on this plus the canned stews, but switched her to just the dry due to cost. She loves it.

reviews.review_title: Excellent food, had to switch back to it
reviews.review_text: I stopped using this product and switched to a less expensive alternative, after 2 recalls from the other food manufacturer I am back to using Blue Buffalo which seems to do pretty good with food manufacturing and avoiding contamination. I guess you get what you pay for, cheaper options seem to lack current good manufacturing practices to ensure a high quality product. I work with an organization that deals with cGMP for manufacturing processes every day, so I'm not bad at recognizing a serious manufacturer following cGMP. I'm paying a little more but I care about my dogs so I don't mind.

reviews.review_title: AWFUL smell, but my dog likes the food
reviews.review_text: This dog food smells so awfully fishy, that I have to double bag it or else, it'll take over the whole room. My dog loves this food, so I can't complain about the quality. However, I will be switching her back to the regular Blue food (in the blue bag) because I just can't deal with the smell of this one.High quality food, awful fish smell.

I'm sure that Blue Buffalo can be a great dogfood because it's holistic, but it wasn't for us.We bought Blue Buffalo for our black lab boxer mix because we did research and, based on the millions of brilliant reviews and the company's standards, it appeared amazing.An amazing disaster more like.Our poor pooch (and us, because we had to clean it up) had regular diarrhea episodes on this dog food, which smelled rancid. When she wasn't having diarrhea, she was having a very loose stool and pooping a lot when she went on her walks. I thought I was because we bought her the healthy request, so I decided to try the 

Blue Buffalo Dry Dog Food, Lamb and Rice Recipe, 30-Pound Bag

  .That didn't help matters at all. After she had an accident in our kitchen, I decided to do research. I thought maybe she had a bug or something, since we did just get her from the pound a little over two weeks prior. Why would a dog food that was supposed to be the best be the culprit?Apparently, Blue Buffalo is a rich food that isn't tolerated by all dogs due to it being high in protein (regardless of flavor). By typing in "Blue Buffalo Loose Stool" on Google, I got loads of hits from concerned dog owners of different breeds having the exact same issue.I switched our girl to Purina One Smartblend, and she loves it...and no more stinky, loose poop!

reviews.review_title: Dog loves it, and she's back at her ideal weight!
reviews.review_text: My dog loves this food and after about 2 months of eating it, she has already gone from being 100 lbs. (she stayed with her grandma and was spoiled rotten), back down to her healthy weight of around 60-65 lbs. She seems happier, is definitely more energetic, and I'm jealous of her metabolism.For reference, she is a 7 year old Walker Hound / Greyhound mix.

I switched my dogs from chicken soup for the pet lovers soul to blue buffalo and immediately my dogs and my cat started shedding so bad that I had furballs rolling around my house like tumbleweed! I kept them on it to see if it was just an initial reaction to the food change only to find that they started itching like they had fleas and had so much dander they looked like they had rolled in powder. I then read the ingredient panel to find the second ingredient in blue is chicken meal... Chicken meal could be anything! So after much reading of ingredient panels the one food I have always known to be five star was Merrick and they love their wet food so I switched them to Grammys pot pie dry food and viola! Instant change! In less than three days my dogs dander has gone away, their coats are shiny and beautiful again and the tumbleweeds of hair have stopped. I think that with all the advertising by blue they just have their name out there more but really it isn't much better than a grocery store dog food, I mean really chicken meal?! When it claims to be so much better then other foods I expect it to make them look beautiful not dusty and shedding like crazy. I only write this so that people can know that it all depends on the dog and that sometimes the less flashy things are better. Merrick dog foods have never let me down and I shall not be switching unless something changes. Oh also I noticed that Blue had a voluntary recall of their dry dog foods due to too much vitamin D, it's on their website all the details so check your bags sell by dates to the ones listed. Hope this was helpful!

reviews.review_title: Who wouldn't like sweet potato and fish?
reviews.review_text: I'm supposed to write at least 20 words about this product.  What more can you say than my dog loves Blue Buffalo dry dog food.  No dog I ever owned wagged his/her tale over dry dog food.  This is a first.  I purchased the fish and sweet potato.  My dog had been eating the cheaper dog food until I protested to my husband.  After a few weeks people commented that he looked thinner.  He is thinner because there are no fillers, just healthy food. He is now satisfied with less because it is real nutrition.

A few months ago I adopted two Dachunds, that are 11 years old, after their owner passed :( ...They were so overweight and raised on people food.  I had big concerns for their backs!!  After trying several, and I mean A LOT, of different kinds of foods, I had some friends recommend Blue Buffalo. Amazingly they love it and I am no longer feeling the guilt of cutting out people food.  Not that they don't get a pizza crust now and then ;).<3 Milly and Oscar and hope to have them for a long long time.So between this food and Cosequin for Milly's arthritis, they are acting like pups again.  Well almost LOL

reviews.review_title: It is not cheap to buy it here anymore!
reviews.review_text: Ive used blue buffalo for last 3 years!. Amazon has change and prices and availability... I.e. they no longer sell 30lb. End tge price no is high!!I just bought same product ( 15lb ) at petsupplies.com for a total price of $ 31.79Thats more than $ 11 difference and it got here very fast!...Your Welcone! ;)

reviews.review_title: Happy Customer with a HAPPY pup
reviews.review_text: My dog is an older Chocolate Lab. He has always had problems with the foods he'd eat. He has always had horrible gas that would stink up the whole house on nearly every food.My Vet suggested Blue. A little more expensive but she said it is easier on an older dog as well has less fillers that might be causing the gas and weight gain. I now have a happy dog and I am so happy that he doesn't pass gas nearly as much and it DOESN'T SMELL!!!!!!I took him back into the vet, he is now at a healthy weight and had a great check up.Buy this for your pup!

We switched over to this dog food on a referral from a friend.  Wow, what a difference in our dog. She just seems happier and more playful.  Only problem is she won't eat the black kernals that are in this dogfood.  Other than that I love this dog food.

My husband and I had to look for a new dog after our little guy kept having stomach issues.  Isn't doesn't help that he's a goat and eats everything is site (even if it's not meant to be edible).  I had heard good things about this brand and it has done wonders for friends who have pets with severe food allergies.  It was definitely the right choice for us.Both of our dogs have been on the Lamb and Rice for almost a year.  The only reason I gave this excellent food 4-stars instead of 5 is the price.  I don't care where you get this food, it's MUCH more expensive than other foods.  We tried to switch our dogs off Blue for that reason, but they simply didn't do as well.  Their coats are shinier, their bowels are more regular (TMI?), etc.  We'll stick with this food for as long as we can!

First, I must say, Yay for Blue Buffalo! It is a great product for appropriate feeding for your dog/cat. For the pet's stomach ease slowly transition even though the grain-free wholesome food is better. 25% is suggested.Now, for this paticular product I've never seen a small bag cost $52. It's always nearly but not quite $20. I dont think it ever did. This may be false hype. Take your time and investigate what is best for your pet based on activity level, age, ext. More than likely you will already have your dog on another dog food and have plenty of time to decide what's good for transition.

After doing some research, and having a general feeling that I needed to get our beloved Shih Tzu off of a store bought brand that touts itself as being for "Pedigree" dogs in their small crunchy bits formula, I wanted to switch her to something of high quality.One of the things that started to steer me towards a new quality dog food was the content and lack of consistency of our beloved fur baby's little poos.  They were always very dry, pebbly, crunchy and small.  Sometimes she would go multiple times when out walking in one day just to empty out her "system".  Sometimes she would go 2-3 days without pooing a nugget.  When she would go, it looked like she was having to put a monumental effort into it, with straining, grunting, eyes bugging out, etc.  Since this had been the norm all her life, and she certainly was never in a state of dehydration, we finally asked our vet what the deal was, and she pointed at the food.Enter Blue Buffalo.  After a very, very slow and successful acclimation process, things got much better (you really must do this over 6-weeks).  We never had any of the issues some folks in other reviews of mentioned of overly runny poo, diarrhea, etc.  What we did notice was that her poo became very consistent, regular, and she now poos something the size of a BUFFALO patty.  O.o  They are huge, a bit moist, tender and very fragrant now!  The straining and grunting is gone.  When she goes now, they just shoot out of her like a well oiled, long rocket exiting a missile silo.  You can also smell it from 20' away on an upwind breeze.  Just how you'd expect a fresh mound to be.  We are still shocked that something of that size could even emanate from a 12lb precious.We were a bit surprised at the size of the food itself.  We started with the small breed sized food and it was way to small.  The normal sized food was more on order of being comparable to the old food.  To give a comparison, the small breed size is about pea sized.  The regular is more like the size of irregular shaped, small marbles.  She liked the normal size much better, as she could actually feel like she had something to chew on, which is better for her teeth anyway.We have also noticed a significant improvement in her coat and skin.  She has long suffered from hot spots and dry skin patches that she would sometimes incessantly chew on.  We used to have to give her a medication from the vet (a form of steroid) to cool her skin at times during the summer to keep her from chewing herself raw in certain areas.  This has all disappeared!In summary, the food is great stuff, and has worked several wonders on our beloved Shih Tzu.  Hope it does the same for your fur babys!

BB Lamb and Rice keeps my two greyhounds in top shape.  My male is a very picky eater, and even turns up his nose at homemade chicken and rice, but he bolts this kibble down.  I add a couple of tablespoons of BB canned food with warm water to make a gravy on my greyhounds' kibbles, and they love it.  Greyhounds require very high protein feed in measured amounts or they don't thrive.  I've found this product to be excellent for them.

We have used this dog food for quite some time and think the nutritional value is worth the price. I am very disappopinted however that I am finding thatthe 15 lb bag has not been available. The smaller one is too small and the larger one would get stale before my terrier could consume it all. Have been forced to go to the local pet store and they didn't have the 15 lb either. Got stuck with the smaller bag and paid as much for it as I have paid for the 15 lb with Amazon

I am writing this review to warn other dog owners of Blue Buffalo for dogs and what it has done to my 5 yr. old Miniature Dachshund named "Calla". Back in late October 2011 I switched to Blue Buffalo after it was recommended by a family member. By mid-November Calla started to cry out at night. We thought it might be a back issue and our "Three" yes three Vets agreed that it could be Intervertebral Disc Disease. We had blood work done in November and everything looked fine with the exceptions that she was a "little" dehydrated. After months of treatments, with little to no improvement we thought it might be a stomach issue and I started to think about the timing of the change to Blue Buffalo, then I went and goggled "Consumer complaints about Blue Buffalo Pet Foods" and started to really connect the dots. Yesterday she was diagnosed with "Pancreatitis" and needs to be in the hospital for days for treatment. I have spent over 3K to this point and do not know if Calla will ever recover fully from this. She was a completely healthy dog before we changed to Blue Buffalo and since have been living in Hell with nighty episodes. Please read up on this issues people are having with this product before you buy. I wish I could give a product -minus 5 stars!!!!

I am writing this review to warn other dog owners of Blue Buffalo for dogs and what it has done to my 5 yr. old Miniature Dachshund named "Calla". Back in late October 2011 I switched to Blue Buffalo after it was recommended by a family member. By mid-November Calla started to cry out at night. We thought it might be a back issue and our "Three" yes three Vets agreed that it could be Intervertebral Disc Disease. We had blood work done in November and everything looked fine with the exceptions that she was a "little" dehydrated. After months of treatments, with little to no improvement we thought it might be a stomach issue and I started to think about the timing of the change to Blue Buffalo, then I went and goggled "Consumer complaints about Blue Buffalo Pet Foods" and started to really connect the dots.
