Yesterday she was diagnosed with "Pancreatitis" and needs to be in the hospital for days for treatment. I have spent over 3K to this point and do not know if Calla will ever recover fully from this. She was a completely healthy dog before we changed to Blue Buffalo and since have been living in Hell with nighty episodes. Please read up on this issues people are having with this product before you buy. I wish I could give a product -minus 5 stars!!!!

My two year old Schnauzer isn't a picky eater at all, but I could tell she really liked this dog food. With her old dog food, she would normally leave a little in the bowl, but not with the Blue Buffalo. I like that Chicken is the first ingredient listed. All the other ingredients are very healthy too. It does cost more than what I was buying before, but my dog is worth the extra expense. So I will continue to buy the Blue Buffalo Chicken and Rice dog food.

reviews.review_title: I swear by Blue Buffalo for my dogs
reviews.review_text: My father adopted a dog a year and a half ago to train for search and rescue work.  My dad considered diet to be an integral part of keeping the dog's mind and body finely tuned for search and rescue work so he conducted a few trial months of various dog foods, monitoring changes in energy level, coat health, bowel movements, and general interest in taste.  Blue Buffalo performed the best.  My dad's dogs coat is now extremely plush with no dry flakiness he had when he was first adopted, at a very healthy weight with tons of energy, has had no illnesses whatsoever, and happens to thoroughly enjoy his meals.I adopted a dog for myself about 5 months ago.  The previous owner warned me of his having an sensitive and irritable stomach (prone to diarrhea and bloating) and being picky about foods. Because of that, they'd had him on some ridiculously expensive prescription foods.  He wasn't at a healthy weight and had dry itchy skin with excess shedding, and was a little lethargic.  I immediately switched him over to Blue Buffalo when I got him home, since it worked so well for my dad.  His skin has since totally recovered.  He hasn't had any bowel problems, even when I give him the occasional table scrap. He's now has a very sleek athletic body. And I get compliments all the time about how glossy and beautiful his coat is.  I swear by Blue Buffalo to keep my furry friend healthy, comfortable, and happy.Also, even though it's more expensive upfront than some other main brands, the food is so nutritious that he doesn't need to eat as much of it as he does the others, and it actually saves me money in the long term.

reviews.review_title: What more can I say, my dog loves this stuff!
reviews.review_text: Don't know if there is anything I can really say in terms of a review about dog food, but I do know that my dog loves this food!  My in law did a bunch of research on dog food for their own dogs and found that this brand was very good in terms of not using filler products to make their food so I tried it out.  In any case, this seems to be working out really well for my dog!!!

My Boxer seems to like this food pretty well. I got the duck flavor because she really likes the duck wrapped rawhde chew sticks. It is expensive in my opinion but if I can afford it, I may buy more.Ingredients seem to be high grade.
My dog loves this food and it makes me feel good that he is eating right.  He was like a dog in a commercial eating it for the first time.

My dogs are crazy.  I've tried for years to get them to eat high quality foods.  We've done Innova Evo, Wellness, Canidae, Call of the Wild.  They always act like I'm torturing them.  So I would end up feeding them Purina Pro Plan and feeling bad about life.  One day, my husband accidentally purchased a bag of Purina One and then they insisted that was the only food for them.  They decided to bunch Pro Plan in with the health foods and boycott it.One of my dogs is pretty skinny with a very high metabolism, so I can't afford him showing ribs and convincing people I'm not feeding him.  So for a while I gave in, and just mixed a high quality food in with the Purina One and let them pick out the pieces.Anyways, I decided to try Blue Buffalo because I was almost out of food and my car was acting funny and there it was on Amazon Prime... HOLY HELL they love this food!  They just eat it right up, no complaints, no looking back at me expectantly.  They enjoy it even more than they enjoyed their garbage food, and I don't have to feel bad about what I'm feeding them!The ingredients are great, the caloric content is good and pretty dense for my skinny boy, and the kibble size is good for my three sized dogs (XL, Medium, and Small but Fat).I'm looking forward to trying the other flavors and perhaps trying a higher quality Blue Buffalo food, but for now I'm just glad they're eating something decent for once!

Chose weight control to help our lab lose a little weight. This food has helped do exactly that. The only warning I will give is that she experienced some extraordinary gas when switching over to this food. This was with mixing it with her old food for about two weeks. Eventually her body adjusted to the food and she isn't making the stinky like when she first started eating it. Love too having it delivered to the front door instead of having to lug it around the pet store and out of the car.

I thought I was buying my 3 year old rat terrier (she weighs about 20 pounds but is just a bigger rat terrier, she is quite trim) a good dog food when I took my vets recommendation of Purina Pro Plan.Turns out I was wrong.  She has always had tons of energy, trim build, and shiny fur, but since we've switched her to Blue Buffalo the change has been pretty astonishing.  Her hair is so shiny black that in this springtime sun she looks like she's glistening.  Even from switching a dog from a horrible dog food to something like purina pro plan I haven't seen this much of a change.  I highly recommend this brand.I got her Lamb and Rice, which she loves.  With the old dog food she would eat it, but you could tell she didn't really like it all that much.  She comes running when I fill the bowl up now.  She's silly and she picks the little "vitabits" or whatever they're called out but will eat them when I put them back in the bowl?I do recommend switching a dog slowly to this if you're coming from a lower quality dog food.  It can be hard on their stomachs...if you've ever switched to a very healthy diet very quickly you can probably relate.

I have a beautiful lab mix and she has had skin hot spots her entire life  - I have tried all kinds of dog foods  from very cheap to very expensive  --I tried making myself last year  and nothing worked like this dog food  -- Her skin was inflamed and uncomfortable  --- we have been using this dog food since nov and her skin is clean normal--  no dry spots --  she looks great  !  she has very pretty fur  --  very silky-- I know this food is expensive but it is worth it  --  she isn't miserable -- and that makes the cost in itself -- no more trips to vet  --  she doesn't eat as much food as she did other dog foods -- there are no fillers in this and it has made dog very happy  - I would recommend especially if you have a big dog breed who make get skin hot spots  --

reviews.review_title: Pups are healthier- and not itching all the time!
reviews.review_text: There is a noticeable difference in our dog's scratching once on this food (they were on Beneful before). They do not itch anymore and they used to it constantly. I have not noticed weight loss in either, but they are happy, healthy and love the food. I like the food because there is no seafood in it, which gives our dog's bad breath. There breath is fresh (or at least not smelly) with this food. We have a Golden Retriever and Puggle.*The first couple of times I ordered it Amazon offered free shipping and now I noticed they are charging for shipping. Hopefully this will change or else I will be looking to purchase from a different vendor.
I changed my dog's food to this because she was having really bad ear infections, and since then, her ears have cleared up!  She seems to really like it.
We had tried so many other brands that claimed to be good for dogs, but Blue Buffalo delivers with a excellent product that our dogs will actually eat.

My dog has been eating BB now for several years.  After realizing that standard kibble was full of junk and other cancer causing agents in dogs, I switched her to BB.  She GOBBLES her food down each and every day now to where before she would get bored with her food and stop eating it well.  Her favorite is the Fish and Sweet Potato.  :)

reviews.review_title: A terrific dog food and helps my pudgy dogs
reviews.review_text: I have five dogs. One has extreme food sensitivities to gluten and wheat. As three of my dogs are labs, which tend to be somewhat food gluttons, it is nice to find a dog food that helps them maintain their weight.This is an excellent product. Even my dog with the food sensitivities has no problem.And they all are keeping their svelte figure.This product is excellent and from my point of view, clearly one of hte best products for keeping your dog healthy and fit.

After slowly transitioning to this food over the period of a week, I did notice some looser stools just as many other people reviewing this product.  Towards the end of this transition time the stools became normal and it is a dogfood that he loves to eat.  I can't say that the "lifebits" that are in the mix is his favorite thing to eat, but most of the time his bowl is clean.  If he leaves anything in his bowl, it would be a few (2-3) of those which is a very small percentage of what was in the bowl to begin with.My dog IS a PICKY eater and with other brands I have often had to add a small treat to his bowl in order for him to eat it all, but I do not have that issue with this brand.  The one thing that I have done is to add some warm water to the bits which makes them softer as well as release the aroma and flavor.  My dog reacts the same way as he would have if I put some gravy on top of his food when I do that.He has gone from walking up to his bowl and looking at me wondering where his "treat" is so that he can eat to jumping up on his hind legs, bouncing around excited that he is about to be fed.The only downside I can think of with this product is that just like some other posters pointed out, there was evidence of some loose stool during transition and that the lifebits does not seem to be something that he enjoys eating.

This food made my dog fart incessantly.  Like, the very winds of hell.  Of course, she absolutely loved it, but I didn't enjoy being assaulted with farts as she slept next to me.  It was a no-go for us.

My border collie mix was having itching so intense that I had to put a cone on her to keep her from destroying her skin. Otherwise, she would chew until she had raw wounds. We took her to the vet and they suggested she may have food allergies. They wanted us to try a pricey kind of Science Diet, but said that we could also start with a lamb and rice formula. The Science Diet was expensive and had of a lot of unnatural ingredients, so we decided to try this dog food instead. It has been great for her. As soon as it arrived she was sniffing excitedly at the bag. We put her on this food immediately because we wanted the itching to stop. I think as a result she vomited a few times in the beginning due to the abrupt change. She also had gas. Now she is nearly through the bag of food and those issues have all but disappeared. Her hair has grown back and her coat is shiny and healthy. No more incessant chewing and no more raw spots!

My dog has never liked kibble, so I just cooked balanced meals for him.  I started him on the Blue Buffalo Chicken and Rice because I couldn't cook for him while we were on our road trip.  He loved it and seemed to thrive on it. He didn't develop any of the digestion problems or loose stools that other reviewers have mentioned.  Now that we're home, I give him about a half portion of this product supplemented with what I've cooked for him.

reviews.review_title: Good food but super slow shipping from Amazon
reviews.review_text: The first few times is ordered this food I got it in 2 days with Amazon Prime.  Somewhere along the way they changed it to take 2-4 weeks before it ships.  It is really hard to plan to have adequate food on hand with that kind of shipping speed.

I've been feeding BB for 7 years and my two Bouviers des Flandres, Harley and Butkus enjoy it.  I like the cold process on the life-source bits to preserve the vitamins.  But, mostly I like the lack of corn and other lower nutrient ingredients.My only complaint about BB is the down-sizing of the 35lb bag to a 30lb bag a few years back---and then eventually raising the price.  35lb's got me through a 2week payday cycle, now I run out just before that.I highly recommend this dog food.

reviews.review_title: BB for my minpin with a sensitive stomach ..
reviews.review_text: I have a miniature pinscher with a sensitive stomach ..  I put him on BB fish and sweet potato and he doesnt throw up or have diarrhea any more .. and just recently we got a rescue female minpin  .. she had no problem at all adjusting to it ..  she hasnt gained weight tho ... (she's a little under weight)  but we have only had her a month .. after I had put my first dog on BB my vet had suggested the science diet ..  i just didnt like it .. cant explain why .. after a week I put him back on BB ... I am very happy with the thought of my minpins being so healthy from of this food ..  the smell doesnt bother me at all .. it is so much better than cleaning up after a sick dog ..  (the science diet smelled like chicken coop, maybe that's why I didnt like it) ..

...but of course, "Jacob" the exuberant, 16-month old Weimaraner rescue has a VERY broad definition of "edible":-)Full disclosure: everything we place in his dish fills him with delight.We purchased this brand based on the recommendations of the local breed club and a local dog specialty shop. Although our dog is a pet, and neither a show nor field dog, it was clear that owners with major investments in their show and field animals had high regard for this food.While I haven't sampled it, the manufacturer's emphasis on "human-grade" primary ingredients appeals to us. In the workplace, we often talk about "eating our own dog food" in evaluating services and products delivered to customers, and this is also true for the food we choose for out pets.An additional note about this food. Without getting too graphic, cleaning up after your dog might present a slightly different experience. We've noted a slightly softer consistency overall. Just be prepared for a change in what your dog leaves behind...
the dog food came quickly, and for my labrador, who has food allergies, it is excellent, as it contains no corn, wheat or other grain products. Service was fast and efficient, arrived as promised.

I have a 12 year old Australian Shepherd mix that has been eating Purina One for years.  Purina changed the recipe, and my dog was clearly not happy with the change.  I began checking out alternatives, and wanted her to have the best food available at a reasonable price.  However, I was very concerned that she might not like healthier food.I read many good things about Blue Buffalo, and am so glad I took the chance on it -- my dog loves it!After 2 months on this product, I can't honestly say that I've noticed any difference in her behavior or appearance -- but at least I know she's eating healthier.Highly recommended!

reviews.review_title: Is this what stopped my dog's diarrhea?
reviews.review_text: We have a 6 year old Rottweiler who has always had a tendency to bouts diarrhea. Someone mentioned this dog food to me and I decided to try it, simply because I think it's good to use different foods from time to time. Once we started her on this, her bouts of diarrhea have almost entirely stopped. This could well be the reason.

Although this food does have good quality ingredients, my German Shepherd never really had any solid stools while on it.  While switching him to this food, he had diarrhea even though I switched him over VERY slowly.  I still stayed with the food thinking that the diarrhea had to do with switching the main meat component from lamb to chicken.  After three months on it though, his stools are still mostly runny.  I have since change to the Taste of the Wild which he actually love to eat (it smells pretty good too) and his stools are improving.  This does not mean that Blue Buffalo is not a good choice for your dog.  Rather I would try it out and see how your dog does on it.  If you find that their stools are not improving then switch.

My Beagle/Terrier mix was having siezures. At the time I was feeding her food you can buy at a grocery store. After a particularly bad siezure, I researched the internet and saw something about diet contributing to siezures and the bi-products in cheap dog food. I switched her to the Blue Buffalo, she loves it, eats less and has not had a siezure in over 2 years!

reviews.review_title: this is the best dog food ever made his fur soft as a baby bunny
reviews.review_text: This is a great food just read the ingrediants better than most humans eat .It made his fur so soft and gives him great energy and he is 10 years old.I tell everyone i know about this food and how good it is for your pet.So many foods are over priced and made with cheap ingrediants dont be fooled by a name of a dog food cheak out the label if it is beef by product or beef or chicken meal you are buying cheap food and only paying more for the name you have to read the bag to see whats in it not just the name of the dog food.

We have 2 dogs, Dachshund and a German Shepherd.  Our GSD has a food senitivity to many commercial foods which was narrowed down to the fillers and other junk found in many dog foods, even "premium" brands.  Our astute vet recommended a food with high quality meat protein and a novel carbohyrate source such as sweet potato or rice, but one only.  After several foods, (all "premium", at least in price) we tried Blue Buffalo.  Problems disappeared in a snap.  She competes in working trials and Schutzhund work and has more energy and vitality; coat looks shiny and great.  She's been on this food now for 2 years and has done fantastic, both dogs love the taste.  I'm not a holistic tree-hugger, but this is a top quality product--ingredients are nothing you couldn't feed a person.  Read the ingredients on the food you feed; corn is garbage in dog food and a filler only, it is poorly digested by dogs and has zero nutitional value in a canine.  So many companies also use "meat by-products" which can mean anything from feathers, beaks, hooves and other scraps to outright rendered road kill, diseased and euthanized animals--I've actually called a couple of other companies to inquire about what exact forms of "meat" they use, and ALL refused to elaborate.  This food really is not much different in price than many other "high end" dog foods and is clearly a healthier choice for your best friend.  And no, I do not work for Blue Buffalo.
Blue Buffalo is one of a few dog foods that is really good for the dog! So many have fillers, corn, etc. which are very bad for all dogs!

Since using Blue, my active English Pointer hunting dog is more lean and muscular. And, when I changed from a major brand dog food to Blue Brown Rice and Lamb. My dog just looked healthier. His endurance noticeably improved. Bottom line, Walker just was better off.We just did not know what an improvement the Blue would produce. my dog is very valuable. He works hard. He brings great joy to us. I order Blue online, and have it delivered. I always valued nutrition for my kids...same goes for my hunting dog !
My Bailey loves his Blue Buffalo and I love ordering it from Amazon.  I always receive it earlier than the ship date I am given.  I love that!  Thanks for the great service Amazon.

I love and my dogs love blue buffalo...but this particular bag was mostly life source bits. (compared to the last bag I bought.  Lets put it this way...poured 1 cup and only 10 pieces of meat bits and the rest life source bits.  Can't possibly be healthy and has made me a little gun shy of ordering this particular version of dog food.

Our 3 dogs (Lab, Border Collie and Pomeranian) are all doing very well on this Blue Buffalo dogfood.  We feed the older dog the product they make for older dogs!  They are healthy and happy and their coats are shiny again.  We  had been using Iams for many years, and something changed in the last year or so, and they didn't have the shine, and I find that to be an indicator of good health.  Also they were shedding more than normal.  I switched to this food, about 4 months ago, and they are doing so much better.  Our dogs are not picky eaters, so I am not sure if all dogs would love it, but they do! We will continue to feed them this brand.

reviews.review_title: My dog developed stones while on this diet
reviews.review_text: My dogs love these kibbles as much as they love soft treats. However, one of my dogs, a 5-year-old bichon, started passing many small stones in her urine while on this diet. I have since moved her to a diet of Kirkland canned dog food and fresh home cooked chicken and rice. She has not had any new issues with stones.

This food is the best.  My dog has been eating Blue Buffalo for 4 of his 5 years.  He is fit and muscular.  The other supermarket dog foods were like eating high fructose corn syrup, giving him a sugar high, but no nutrition.  What a difference.  Worth every penny.

I have two male Jack Russells.  One started gaining weight and was quite a bit heavier than the other.  I decided to try this food and it has worked very well for the heavier dog, but not well for the other.  I gradually changed their food at the same time and the skinnier dog's stomach started rumbling and it just plain didn't agree with him.  My thought was maybe the fiber content was too difficult for him to handle.  I switched him back to the regular Blue Buffalo Chicken dog food and he has been fine.  The heavier dog has been on this for over a year and has had no problems.  His weight gain has stopped and he's even lost a couple of pounds.  Make sure you gradually change your dog's food to this as an abrupt change will most likely give your dog problems.
My dog doesn't like the Chicken/Rice food but he likes this Fish/Sweet Potato food. I'm glad I can stop searching for the right dog food and buy this from now on.

My German Shepherd was served Blue as a puppy so I tried it for a while. Changed to another brand, and due to the unavailability of it I used Blue again. Even when I stopped feeding it to him a nightmare of a couple of weeks followed. I will not take the chance of using it again.

reviews.review_title: Quality pet food that my dog loves
reviews.review_text: The is a unique quality dog food made of quality ingredients. My dog, a 3 year old standard poodle, has more energy and playfulness without loss of trained behaviors. Recommended without reservation.

Max is getting up in age and subsequently is not able to exercise like he once did.  We were cutting back on the amount of food, to compensate. Max was NOT happy. He loves Blue Buffalo Weight Control Formula, plus it not filled with a lot of meal and by products. He's HAPPY and much leaner now.
My dog loves this food. I feel good giving it to him knowing that meat is always the first ingredient and it is packed with things he needs (and no corn!).

reviews.review_title: Blue Buffalo Weight Control Dog Food
reviews.review_text: Blue Buffalo is excellent dog food.  If you compare ingredients with the top Grocery Store brands, you find that premium foods like Blue Buffalo provide quality nutrition, where brands like Purina are full of filler and cancer causing by products.  You can buy those brands cheap, but for anyone that loves their dog, that is a betrayal.  Go to the compare sites and see what is in your brand of dog food.
Great food for our dog, Alex.  She likes it and I believe it is a nutritious meal for her.  She gets a cup morning and night.

reviews.review_title: Wished it would have worked out
reviews.review_text: Our veterinarian recommended Blue Buffalo. We have a very itchy corgi mix and was hoping this food would be the answer. We switched from Iams premium protection. He had no stomach troubles with the switch which we did over about a week. He has been on it about five weeks now. At first it seemed to be helping, but I had also started bathing him more frequently. This week I noticed more hair loss than normal and now he has some bald patches and sores in his armpits. I guess we will be switching him back and try to find something new.I don't think that there is anything wrong with the food, but there is something in it that makes our dog's allergies worse and not better.

reviews.review_title: Blue Bluffalo-does make my dog Blue but happy!
reviews.review_text:
We have a dog that can not eat chicken or related meat.  So our vet recommended a dog that cost some 90$ @ 25lbs bag.  We , after reading several reviews about Blue Buffalo dog food, tried a small bag of it.  To make a long story shorter he LOVES it and no side effects. 

Blue Buffalo Dry Dog Food, Lamb and Rice Recipe, 30-Pound Bag

Mr. T.

I absolutely love giving my dog Blue. She is healthy and has a beautiful coat. She's a black lab. I would highly recommend this food to anyone. Only two negatives that I can see. One is that it's expensive and my dog goes through one full size bag a month but she's totally worth it so even if I had 5 dogs I'd feed them all Blue. Second is that she gets bad gas at times and I think it's from the food but I am not 100% sure.

My retriever absolutely loves this food ( which maybe isn't totally relevant as he eats anything on the ground when we go for walks). The ingredients though are excellent and his coat looks great. I'd highly recommend.

we have tried every dog food on the planet (almost) our dog was getting skin disorders and lethargy, so we went back to blue buffalo and within 5 days he is not shedding, his coat is shiny again and he is bouncing again. great dogfood. won't ever change again

We started using  Blue Buffalo Dry Dog Food because our Golden Retriever was constantly scratching, and her coat was dull.  I was told that the retriever breed is often sensitive to corn and the other "fillers" used in the less expensive bags of dog food, and was told to look for kibble that is corn and filler free, with protein and vegetables as the most prevalent ingredients.  Voila!  The scratching stopped, her coat is shiny, her teeth are tartar free, and she is thriving.  Happy, healthy dog, happier dog owner.  It gets delivered right to my front door, so I don't have to lug the thirty pound bag.  Thank you, Amazon.

My dogs love this food and my dog's dandruff has disappeared after a few weeks. I love this food but unfortunately because of the price i can't ccontinue to use it. I am going to try a different brand. The food has a strong fish smell which is to be expected.

I switched the dogs to this food from Eukaneuba Natural Lamb and Rice when we rescued a lab.  The trainer gave us a list of recommended foods and I read great reviews about this one.  Our golden retriever always had a good coat, but it was a little stiff.  It is so soft since switching 3 months ago.  I don't mix anything with the food, my dogs make little happy noises when I feed them because they like it so much.  Works great for us!

my dog won't eat this food.  she smelt it and walked away.  it does have an awful smell to it.  the expiration date is still good, but than I don't  know when it was manufactered or what expected shelf life should be. i would like a refund of my money if that is possible.  I can ship it back but am unsure who pays the shipping.  It probably will cost 15 or more to ship back.

My dog developed an allergy to poultry products  and I tried this as an alternative. He absolutely loves it. I often mix it with Beneful simmered Beef or Beef Stew. He's getting great nutrition and snarfs it up as soon as set it on the floor for him.

My 50 Lb goldendoodle had been eating Blue Buffalo for a year, but this time her stomach did not agree with it. She had loose stool for a week after I gave her this bag of food since we ran out of last one. And then she kept having pretty bad stomach. I finally decided to cook her food myself--rice with chicken or beef with vegetable. She loved it!! And her stool was normal. A week later I tried to switch to the Blue Baffalo again, no way! Bad stomach again. So I threw away the Blue Baffalo dry dog food and decided to move on to different brand name. I assumed this time the dry food was rancid or got contaminated because my dog had same food before and she was ok.

reviews.review_title: Wish I had tried it sooner!
reviews.review_text: We have a 9 1/2 year old English Bulldog with bad skin allergies. He was diagnosed at 1 year old and the vet put him on a prescription fish and sweet potato food to rule out a food allergy. It wasn't a food allergy so I went back to his regular food because of the price difference. We've had him on allergy shots ever since which successfully controlled them until we moved from NY to MN 2 years ago. The poor dog has gone through hell ever since. We even had him retested for "MN" allergens and he's been on the shots for a year with no improvement. As a last resort I reverted to our old vet's advice and put him on this to check for a food allergy. We were told symptoms would clear up within 2 weeks if it were a food allergy.Unfortunately it didn't clear up his skin, however his digestive health has been the best it's ever been. His old food made him really gassy and he burped a lot and while he was regular, he only went once a day. He's been on this new food for over 2 months and not only is he hardly gassy at all (the occasional burp), but he poops twice a day and they're healthy poops...not too soft or hard. Even though it's more expensive and didn't solve the skin issues, we'll keep him on a BB food for the rest of his life because we like that it's so healthy for him and he's got to be feeling better since he's not so bloated!We are, however, currently in the process of switching him over to the senior chicken and rice formula. I know senior dogs have different dietary needs than adult dogs so I want to make sure he's getting the right amount of stuff he needs and not too much of things he shouldn't be getting a lot of at his age and activity level.If the BB Lamb and Rice performs just as well as the fish and sweet potato then we're set.

With dog food i learned,  "You get what you pay for"...This food is a great meal for my Pit-bull at a decent value.  The nice thing about this food is because its not full of preservatives,  you do not need to load your dogs bowl up with food.  My dog is medium sized and eats 2x a day.  I spread the bottom of the bowl about 2 layers deep with food and that is more than enough for her until her next meal.  The Bag lasts me about 1.5 months before i have to re-up.  Its also awesome not having to lug around a 50lb bag...AMAZON PRIME FOR THE WIN!!! Right to the DOOR!!!

We love this dog food because of the great high quality ingredients.  No corn filler here!  Our dog Shadow loves this food because of the great taste.  She started out on the puppy formula can has grown in the adult foods.  She's strong and healthy with a beautiful, shiny coat.  We'll never go back to grocery store brands.  We love our dog too much!

reviews.review_title: Dogs didnt like the sweet potato
reviews.review_text: I had my dogs on the Natural Balance Sweet Potato and Fish and decided to try the same in Blue. The dogs would pick every piece of the dark pieces out and drop on the floor. I am assuming this was the sweet potato. They have never done this with the Natural Balance. They did this thru the entire bag. yippee. I just swept it up and fed it to the squirrels. The cats wouldnt eat it either. Picky snobs!
dog had diarrea constantly for more than 4 weeks, switched to candidae and 1st day he was back to normal. gonna stay on candidae

My dog seems to eat this food better than others.  Although, I must say I mix the Blue Buffalo with a handful of Benefeful (for the veggies) and half can of Alpo (for the gravy).  I feel BB has more protein and plan to buy more when this bag is used.

This review includes all varieties and bag sizes of the dry Life Protection Formula - Since switching, my Jack Russell not only gladly consumes it, but her coat and teeth are in much better condition. Don't recall any bowel issues when switching initially. She been on this food for about three months now. Amazon price with Prime membership is an excellent value as well.
This dog food is one of the best ont he market. It was recommended by the foster mom for my dog, and she is thriving on it.

reviews.review_title: Great upgrade over Purina. Worth the price.
reviews.review_text: This food is certainly more expensive than the 50# sack of Purina we were buying at the local club warehouse. From $.50/lb to $1.50/lb. I noticed the dogs getting less interested in the Purina, some health issues creeping into their 6-month exams and I had heard wonderful things about Blue Buffalo. The food is loved by the boys. They have dropped the weight they were packing on, back into prime shape. I cannot say for certain their coats are so much nicer but I do feel confident in the food being better for them. Cockers have a lot of health issues. I figure this is an investment, a money saver in the long run to feed them right than treat the problems with the lesser foods.

I was told from a friend of mine, how great blue buffalo dog food was. I kept telling her I would try it, but never did. The problem was, I would always have a full bag of dog food when she would remind me. I didn't want to waste the dog food I had just bought. Anyway, one day I was ordering off Amazon and said, "what the heck, I'll give it a try." I ordered it, it arrived and my dogs LOVE IT!!! I am never going back! the other (no names) dog food would literately go right through them..YUCK! They weren't getting the proper nutrition and they were not as energetic. Thank you and I am going to keep purchasing BLUE BUFFALO!!!!

Good food, the dogs really like it.  I have three very different dogs with different tastes, but they all like it.We have tried several foods, and bought this based on reviews.  It was great, this one is a keeper.

I am lucky to be able to purchase premium food for my two dogs, and I always choose Blue Buffalo. I have a Great Dane and a Sophie (we have no idea what she is) and both love the sweet potato and fish blend the best. Sophie has some digestive issues on other low end food, and this has cleared all of those issues up. My great dane doesn't eat as much with this food as she did with a lower end food, it is very filling for her. I did have a one time issue with a bag arriving split open and half empty, and Amazon's amazing customer service came through for me. They immediately replaced the bag at no charge and shipped it next day for me, no questions asked. The price for this food is high, but I feel that my dog's are a lot healthier because of the higher quality food. The price is great (and cheaper than my local pet mega-mart), I just wish that Amazon would offer a subscribe and save!

reviews.review_title: My dogs love this food; I love the benefits!
reviews.review_text: First, thank you Amazon for offering this dog food with no shipping! Such a time saver to not have to drive to PetsMart, load a 30 lb bag, drive it home, and carry it in.This food is great. My dogs have been eating it for almost a year. I mix the lamb with the salmon and it has done wonders for their coats! The nice thing is this food does not have many of the ingredients that often trouble my little guy's allergies - but without the 'special allergy-free dog good price'.Thank you Blue Buffalo and Amazon!

Our somewhat finicky Chihuahua loves the Blue Buffalo Lamb and Rice formula.  Our Vet wanted us to try a mixture like this for possible food allergies.  We were worried that our picky guy might not like it, but that has not been a problem!The convenience of ordering through Amazon and not having to make a special trip to another town to locate this particular brand has made this a simple choice.

reviews.review_title: Great food ... if you enjoy cleaning up diarhhea
reviews.review_text: I would give this food -100 stars if possible.  Bought this about a month back.  Slowly transitioned my 7 yr old lab to the food.  First time I gave her more than 1/2 cup she had horrendous diarhhea.  Not just once, were talking many times throughout the night.  Stopped the food.  Got her back on her last food (Iams...allegedly inferior yet never gave her 12 hour diarhhea).  Tried the Blue one more time with the same result.  Google "blue dog food diarhhea" and you'll see that this is not an isolated incident.  I don't know what the story is, but I have never seen my dog so sick from a dog food.  Not worth it.  No thanks. Proceed with extreme caution.  Don't say you weren't warned.Oh and I live in an apartment.  An apartment I just moved into a month ago.  An apartment that is very nice and had brand new carpeting that Ill need to steam clean to get spots out?  Yeah, not too thrilled with Blue.  I'm blue allright.  Blue in the face from the mess I cleaned up tonight.

Our dog has had allergies ever since we got him.  After switching vets trying to determine what was wrong with our Irish Setter, our new vet suggested we try the Blue Buffalo Fish and Sweet Potato food.  After 2 months, our dog is completely allergy free for the first time in 7 years.  The dog food smells a little "fishy", but that is understandable given that it has real fish.

Blue Buffalo is the best pet food out there.  My dog Bailey loves the Fish and Sweet Potato flavor.  He eats it down so fast I am amazed that he doesn't choke!  I have tried other brands with him and while he eats them, it's not with the same relish that he eats the Blue Buffalo.  I also like knowing that the ingredients are healthier for him than Science Diet or Purina.  He is 3 years old and I want him to have a long healthy life, and I believe that with a diet of Blue Buffalo, he will.

Update;I now have two dogs who both do really well on this food. I don’t know if they changed the formula or if my old dog had a weird stomach,but we have no problems with it now.My dog liked the taste of this food just fine.  However, shortly after I transitioned him to this food he developed pretty severe stomach problems.  He had terrible diarrhea and would lie around crying.  When we stopped feeding him this, his tummy problems disappeared like magic.  I thought maybe it was a coincidence so we tried again a few months later and exactly the same thing again.  Therefore I can't recommend this dog food.

Second Bag of the product and my 10 year Lab is still experiencing problems with diarrhea.  We switched to Blue Buffalo Weight Control because our Chocolate Lab was starting to put on weight with Pro Plan Large Breed.  Seems to like eating the food but on his daily walks he has to stop 3 to 4 times from his normal on stop with the dropping always remaining consistent.  The Vet informed us this is a common problem with this product.Maybe just his system but problem corrected days after changing his food only.

reviews.review_title: Buffalo Worst Dog Food ever! Product is toxic and is being recalled! Both of my dogs got extremely sick thanks to this food!
reviews.review_text: First of all, the "gain control" formula is a true joke and has a very deceiving label!!!! One of my dogs gained more than 20 pounds in less than 6 months!!!!!! After 6 months, he could no longer hold the food down as he started vomiting the food and have watery diarrhea 4 to 5 times a day and he would start shaking because he could not hold the food in.  We were so concerned that we took him right away to the vet and vet requested us to change his diet immediately.  We did and his diarrhea stopped right away.  Prior to giving him this food, he was healthy and then coincidentally, he started to have major health problems.To all the people who left comments on my review and think the dry food especially from Buffalo or any other commercial dog food is good and with so much nutrients, then eat it yourself, and see how it works for you ;) I'm sure you'll end up in the hospital. Current pet food regulations allow manufacturers to use ingredients that you would never knowingly give to your pet. In fact, you may be SHOCKED to learn what some companies are putting in their pet food! Take a look  at the video for further info: What's REALLY In Your Pet's FOOD??[...]Furthermore, we got him a companion dog in excellent health condition who was used to eating mainly dry food and we gave her some of this food and to determine whether this food just had an impact (or negative allergic reaction) on our first dog and whether she would be affected or not.  Sure enough, same first day she ate her first bowl of this Buffalo brand food, she had diarrhea and she even woke us up at 2am the first night because she could not hold it anymore. She had diarrhea 6 times in just 24 hours.  A side note on this dog, she has a strong stomach because prior to adopting her, the previous owners told us she eats just about anything from fruits, vegetables, different dry foods and her stomach does not get upset.After all this nightmare and realizing there is no quality at this Buffalo corporation,  we now have started to give them real organic food made by us since we could no longer trust these dog food companies and our older dog has immediately lost the weight he gained thanks to that disgusting, toxic and cheap food. If you have ever watch the movie "Food Inc" and have realized what food is available for human beings, just imagine what type of food these dog food Corporations are selling to our dogs (babies)!Now meal time with our home made food is their favorite time of the day, they absolutely love it and start jumping up and down something that never happened with any type of dry food.  Today to our surprise, we found out that THIS PRODUCT IS BEING RECALL FOR CONTAINING TOXIC INGREDIENTS. We are shocked that by giving them this Buffalo food, we were putting in great danger the lives of our beloved dogs.  If you really love your dog and he/she is truly part of your family, make him/her their own food to protect their health and life. Is really easy to make and does not take that much time.  There are books in Amazon that guides you through the food dogs should and should not eat. Now our dogs eat real chicken, brown rice, veggies, and a spoon of organic multi-vitamin which we mix it all together when serving.  This will not only make them happier, healthier, stronger, but also increase their lifespan.The info below will show you some of the reality and suffering of those who have fed their dogs with Buffalo food:truthaboutpetfood com /articles/more-worrisome-news-on-blue-buffalo-dog-food.html

The UPS driver just delivered the first bag of food for my dogs to try.  Their interest was peaked immediately upon bringing the package into the house.  They quickly followed me into the kitchen and even tried to help me with opening the bag.  I no sooner put the food into their bowls and they immediately started chowing down.  I'm pretty sure they love it!  In fact, I've already reordered the next bag for them.  *****

reviews.review_title: A little more expensive, but worth every penny!
reviews.review_text: We upped our amount that we were willing to spend on our dogs' food and haven't looked back!  Prior to Blue Buffalo, our dogs usually got Pedigree or a store brand that might be on sale at the time. We have really noticed a difference in their coats & energy levels since making the switch.  Their fur is so shiny and they don't just lay around all of the time as they did before.  They don't seem to eat as much of the Blue Buffalo either as I guess that it keeps them fuller longer.Our black lab has some skin issues and many foods make her itch like crazy.  We did try the Chicken & Rice Recipe of Blue Buffalo and it irritated her as well so now we stick to the Lamb and Rice Recipe.  At any rate, if you are considering making the switch I would definitely recommend Blue Buffalo.

Recently my German Shorthaired Pointer started eating a ton of grass. He does eat anything he can find, like an old clif bar that he found on the side of the trail or a croissant that he grabbed out of the front seat of some guys car at the trail head, but grass was unusual. So I started researching the food I was feeding him, which was Science Diet active, and it is kind of a junky dog food. After hemming and hawing over what to feed him I decided to go with Blue Buffalo. It isn't off the Richter scale expensive, about 10 bucks more than the science diet, and the ingredient list is pretty good. It has changed his coat which is beautiful and soft, but he hasn't stopped munching on grass and he has insane gas thus the 4 stars. I am purchasing a second bag and we will see how it goes, but I am not too worried because he hasn't has diarrhea and has regular movements which is good for a neurotic dog.

My boxer, Daisy, loves 

Blue Buffalo Dry Dog Food, Lamb and Rice Recipe, 30-Pound Bag

  ! It does not upset her delicate, boxer tummy and she huffs it down in typical boxer style!

reviews.review_title: Better than Wellness, but still no cigar.
reviews.review_text: I must have the pickiest dog(miniature schnauzer)in existence.  She does not gobble this food any better than the others I have tried, and it is far more expensive.  I have to disguise it with canned food to even get her to try it.  Just a FYI that if your dog is particularly finicky this may not be the answer.  I'm still experimenting, but have not found a complete solution.

reviews.review_title: What A Convenient Way To Get Dog Food!
reviews.review_text: We had been buying this item from one of the pet store chains.  I was glad to see that we could buy it on Amazon for about the same price with prime shipping.  It's great convenience to have it delivered to my front porch and not have to drive to the store and drag this big bag home.We like to feed our dogs a better quality dog food and they really like the Blue Buffalo food.  It's more expensive but the quality ingredients are worth it, in my opinion.

Had to change to a non meat, non poultry protein source due to my dog's inflammatory bowel disease. This food was my vet's recommendation. This food receives a very good rating on Dog Food Advisor, an impartial food rating site. Also switched to Blue Buffalo biscuits of the same composition. Along with meds and the food change he's improving. Also with free shipping on Prime this is a very good price.

my dogs aren't a real fan of dry food, but they have no problem with this brand. I will continue to buy Blue Buffalo. Amazon has the best price and the delivery was practically overnight, plus it was packed well for shipping.

I am totaly satisfied with my order of blue buffalo dry dogfood.  I am a senior pet owner and having this delivered tomy door is great for my pet and I.  Great delivery andproduct.  I will be ordering again.Thanks

This is a great dog food for the pet owner who wants to feel good about the food they give their dog.  We have a cocker spaniel and she responds very well to this food.  Her fur looks great and it cuts down on her allergy break outs and ear issues.  Once in a while she will leave the "life bits" as she's eating the food, but overall it would appear she enjoys feeding time.
We love this dog food...first one that has really worked with our chicken-allergy dogs. Thank you so much for creating a dog food I can feel good about feeding my babies!!
My dogs love the food and thrive on it. The dogs and I are very pleased. By the way, they are two Australian Shepherds.

Originally we bought this primarily because of the shipping. We live in bush Alaska, and Super Saver Shipping is a life saver. As for the product... it's great our dog loves it. The downfall is the fish smell. I personally don't think it is that bad. If you find that when you prepare fish your dog is drooling all over, this is the food you want.

Blue Buffalo is amazing. I have a 90lb lab and 20lb mutt, both get Blue Buffalo and love it! We have tried other brands (Evo, Nutro, etc...) and Blue Buffalo is by far the best.  Our lab gets ear infections from any other type of food and our mutt is a picky eater. Both of them scarf this down with no problems! We also have switched our cat onto Blue Buffalo, and he loves it. HIGHLY recommended, worth the extra money and is it of good quality and you actually end up feeding you pet less of this food than others.

I am in Alaska and my dog's food was no where to be found.I was able to get it from Amazon with free shipping.  TO ALASKA!!It arrived in a very timely manner and even the postal clerk was shocked that I could buy dog food like this with FREE shipping.I am VERY pleased.My dog LOVES blue Buffalo and I did not want to change her food so I am VERY pleased that I was able to get it.I give you a five star plus!!!!!

reviews.review_title: Noticable changes .... but watch for GAS!
reviews.review_text:
All my dogs love this food ... but I ended up switching to 

Blue Buffalo Wilderness Grain Free Dry Dog Food, Salmon Recipe, 24-Pound Bag

  . My lab and dachshunds did just fine, and I could really tell the differences in their coat and they are so much more energetic. But my Great Dane, although loved the food, wouldn't stop having soft stools and I think her shedding got worse. We allowed 3 bags ... so about a month plus/minus a week or so to make sure the new food settle in, but her stomach really didn't like it so we switched the brand. I gave it 4 stars even though we switch because my lab and two weiners didn't have any problem and they liked it just fine. Wilderness is much more expensive, I think, but now all my dogs look and behave even better. It has more nutritious, and it's a different premium level than this one. So ... if you can afford it, try that one. But this is still 1000 times better than craps like Iams and Kibble n' Bits!!!!04/27/2012 UPDATESo we completely switched to Eukanuba since then. We tried all the Blue products that was available -- nothing worked for my Dane. Her stomach isn't liking anything from Blue. So far Eukanuba is the only thing keeping her from diarrhea. It got so bad that I think our vet bill run up to almost $500. Not cool :(

reviews.review_title: My cocker is eating it up!
reviews.review_text: It is too soon to tell if it is going to help her allergies, but my cocker loves the taste of this food. She has serious ear infections and skin problems so I am desperately seeking help.

reviews.review_title: Really liking the lamb Blue Buffalo
reviews.review_text: Growing up, my family always gave our dogs good quality foods like Nutro, so I wanted to make sure my own pets ate well.  I'm on a tight post-college budget, but Blue Buffalo is totally worth it.  My 35 lb corgi mix gets 2/3 cup twice a day (plus whatever falls on the kitchen floor), and a 30 lb bag of Blue Buffalo lasts us 2 1/2 to 3 months.  My dog's coat is beautiful, her stools are normal, her weight is healthy and doesn't fluctuate.  She's a very happy dog, and when I think about how I'm feeding her for $20 a month, I'm a happy owner.We originally had her on the chicken and rice flavor for the first year or so, but when Amazon stopped carrying it we switched to the lamb and rice.  My dog seems to like the lamb even more (though to be fair, she's a corgi mix and will eat anything).  I've also noticed she has significantly less eye boogers than she did on the chicken flavor.  I was wiping substantial boogers off her eyes once or twice a day before, and now I clean just dried stuff off her face maybe twice a week.  She doesn't have any health conditions, so I guess there may have been an allergen in the chicken flavor that's not in the lamb.

My dog loves this food.  As soon as I feed him he scarfs it down.  He would sniff his old food and eventually get around to eating it, not w/ this food.  He absolutely love it.  I will definitely be buying this again.

It's hard for me to rate this stuff, since I've never tasted it myself, but my Beagle absolutely loves it. He had no trouble transitioning to this brand from the crappy stuff his previous owner was feeding him. To be fair, I kept him on that food until the bag they gave me ran out too, so I know what he was like before the switch too.The only problem I've had with it is, as the title of this review suggests, the flatulence. Ever since I switched him over to this food, he's been healthy and happy, but he now has the stinkiest farts I've ever smelled and he unleashes AT LEAST one a day.Sure, it's hilarious when he does it in my room mate's room, but not so much in my own or when we have company over.

reviews.review_title: Blue Buffalo Weight Control Formula Dry
reviews.review_text: This hands down is the BEST dog food I have ever purchased in the almost 50 years I have had dogs. My chubby Rat Terrier has easily lost weight on BLUE and is maintaining now. My dogs' coats are healthy. My dogs are active and healthy at 11 and 7 years old! Thank you BLUE!! And thank you Amazon for the free shipping. I can't lift more than 8 pounds, so shipping this to my home is a God Send:)

the only test I know is if my dog will eat both his meals everyday.  if he does and doesnt have watery poop, then the food is good.  the ingredient list isnt the best but its solid.  i may buy another bag.

This dog food has been wonderful for my one-year old shar pei mix who has sensitive skin.  I fed her the Blue Buffalo puppy chicken & rice and now this.  Her horsecoat is beautiful and silky; I didn't know that was possible for her type of fur.  She is super healthy, active, and muscular.  I would highly recommend this dog food!

reviews.review_title: Blue Buffalo lamb and rice review
reviews.review_text: My dogs love Blue Buffalo lamb and rice recipe...great product, free shipping, received item sooner than expected.  I will order same product from Amazon again!!

reviews.review_title: The ingredients and concept look great
reviews.review_text: I'm on the fence with Blue Buffalo.  Our 2 girls like it okay, it has unique life source bits that make the vitamins very available to the system, high quality ingredients which  means they will have better immune systems to fight off diseases, yada yada.  Of course, I want them to live long and healthy lives.  They are our best friends.  I am always on the lookout for a food that is "better" and I try samples of many and yet come back to the tried and true.Anyway, on with the review.  The girls were on this food for less than a month and I have to say they really enjoyed eating it. My biggest complaint of this food was in the potty dept. with soft, sometimes runny movements that didn't get better with time.  Now, I could have added things like pumpkin or bran to firm things up but I feel at Blue Buffalo prices I should not be adding a thing.  Also, it seemed coat quality went down as well.I do like the Blue Buffalo concept and may sometime in the future try a different formula in their line up or wait and see if they decide to 'fine tune' the Chicken and Rice a little more to be more agreeable.

reviews.review_title: I Like The Poop, My Dogs Like The Food
reviews.review_text: I switched to Blue Buffalo on a recommendation from my mother who has had bulldogs for years.  I had been using Iams Weight Control for my two Cocker Spaniels.  I gradually transitioned from the Iams to BB.  As the transition progressed, my dogs appeared to be more hungry at each feeding.  As it turned out, I think that they were just starting to enjoy their food for the first time in their short little lives. Sad, really.  But how can a person tell if a dog food actually tastes good?  If I were to pick a dog food based on what I THINK might taste good, I would be feeding my dogs Beneful dog food (their commercials make ME hungry).  In any case, they seem to love BB.  So that's the review from the dog's point of view.As for how this change in dog food has impacted MY life.  I live on a half acre and my two cockers can really spread wealth, if you know what I mean.  I really like to keep the lawn "bomb free" so my kids and I pick-up the lawn often.  When the dogs were eating Iams, the "surprises" that they would create would lay softly beneath the top blades of grass, just waiting for someone to come step on them.  It was too often an ugly situation that I will not describe here.  Since we have been feeding the dogs BB, those "duce-balls" now sit lightly upon the TOP of the grass.  They are light, easy to see and very firm (Eauwwwww!) As a result, pick-up is quicker and the lawn is cleaner.I suggest you give this food a try, but be cautious.  Based on some reviews, BB has had some quality problems in the past.  Nobody wants to lose their animal due to negligence on the part of a dog food company.  As with any change in your dog's diet, monitor closely.  Even if a food is safe and healthy, not all foods agree with all animals.  So remember, be cautious, we all want the best for man's best friend.

My dog absolutely loves this food, he goes bonkers for mealtime now! I think the quality products in the food really stand out. My dog was on the Ol'Roy diet before we adopted him and now he is a super star! Lots of energy, healthy shiny coat, Thank you Blue Buffalo! We did start him on the chicken & rice formula first, but he seems to prefer the lamb & rice more =)

We have 6 dogs, all sizes, varieties & ages.  The oldest is 12 years old and the last several years, she has developed a spring/summer skin condition that causes her to itch and scratch and lose her fur.  She would lay on the floor next to us and chew and scratch to try to get some relief.  Her skin would get an oozing rash and she was miserable.  We tried different shampoos, lotions, steroid shots - anything to give her some relief.My wife suggested she might have an allergy to the carbohydrates/gluten in her food that got worse in the south Texas heat.  We ordered a bag of the Blue Buffalo dry dog food and after the first feeding, she laid down next to us and did not scratch one time all evening.  Her fur has grown back and she no longer has the patches of nasty, smelly rash on her.  She now has energy to run up the stairs, run around in the yard and acts like she did as a puppy.  The change in less than a week is amazing!We have ordered more Blue Buffalo for all 6 of our dogs and our cat. Their coats are shinier and their eyes sparkle more.  Thank you for making our pets healthier and happier.

reviews.review_title: One of my dogs liked it,
reviews.review_text: I have 3 large dogs- a Blue Heeler named Buddy, a Black and Tan Coonhound named Rocky and a very large and very hungry Pit Bull named Hutch. Luckily, none of my dogs have any food allergies, so I'm just looking for a good quality food that they all will eat.My Pit bull loves this food, but he's not picky at all and he will eat about any dry dog food out there. My other two dogs are a little pickier. Rocky ate a few bites of this pretty good but he refused to eat it the second time I fed it, Buddy who is my pickiest eater won't touch this dog food at all.The ingredients of this Blue dog food are excellent and I wish that all my dogs would eat it. Buddy seems to prefer Purina Dog Chow, Eukanuba Naturally Wild Turkey and the Science Diet Active Longevity dry food the best of any.So, even though, I know this is good quality dog food I won't repurchase (at least this flavor) I want to find a flavor that all 3 of my dogs will eat.NOTE: I noticed the main ingredient in this is White fish... I've never had a cat who'd actually liked any food with White fish in it maybe my dogs are the same. That probably accounts for the strong smell of this dog food.
Even when Petco has Blue Buffalo on sale, it is cheaper to buy it from Amazon. Plus, I don't pay sales tax and don't have to drive 15 minutes to go buy it! Free shipping to my home!

My Scottish Terrier is a super picky eater.  But not with Blue Buffalo, he cleans his whole bowl and comes asking for more.  After he is finished eating he rubs all over the living room carpet, like we have given him a super special treat.

reviews.review_title: Low fat, but not Blue's lowest calorie formula
reviews.review_text:
Note: Blue Buffalo no longer makes "Weight Control" dog food and instead makes "Healthy Weight" dog food in the "Life Protection line.  Healthy Weight has 415 calories per cup and 3.290 calories/gram.  Compared to the Longevity line for adult dogs, Healthy Weight has more calories per cup but a fewer calories per gram, meaning that Healthy Weight has more grams per cup than Longevity. Looking at the order of ingredients (which is by pre-production ingredient weight), I am concerned that too much of Healthy Weight's protein may come from whole grains, which do not contain all of the amino acids that a dog must get from his or her food (dogs cannot synthesize all the amino acids they need from plants and grains the way humans can.) De-boned chicken is the first ingredient, but, because it contains 75% water before processing, it is not the heaviest final ingredient.  Chicken meal is a high quality protein, but it is listed as the fifth ingredient.Also: At the bottom of this review I name a brand of food that ultimately helped me meet my dog's goals.Overview of Weight Control: While I did not do all I could to make Weight Control work for my dog, it ultimately did not help my dog reach his ideal weight. Blue Weight Control is nutrient rich, very low in fat, and uses high-quality protein sources. Unfortunately, Blue Weight Control has 444 calories per cup, which  is pretty calorie-dense.  I believe it was over 4 calories per gram, which, in human food, is the caloric density of cheddar cheese.  My dog may have been able to eat a satisfying quantity of this food if he only needed to maintain a healthy weight, but he needed to lose weight, and the portions I had to feed him were too small. Fortunately, Blue Buffalo makes an excellent food called 

Blue Buffalo Longevity Dry Food for Adult Dogs, 24-Pound Bag

  , and the adult food has a more reasonable 354 calories per cup, allowing my dog to eat a more satisfying quantity of food per day.Details: My dog weighed 50 lbs. and needed to get to the maximum ideal weight for his breed --44 lbs.-- as determined by my vet and the American Kennel Club.  According to several dog nutritionists, the calories a dog should consume per day to lose weight is computed as follows:  1)Convert his goal weight in pounds to kilograms by dividing the pounds by 2.2.  For my dog 44 lbs over 2.2= 20.  2  Multiply her weight in KG by 30.  For my dog 20*30 is 600. (3)Add 70. In my dog's case, that meant 670 calories per day.  This number represents the dog's caloric needs while on a weight loss diet, assuming the dog has no special needs, such as pregnant or whelping, being a puppy, being a toy breed, working, or living outdoors in cold weather. The formula only is valid if the dog weighs between 5 and 99 pounds. Check with your vet to make sure the daily calories you compute are in the right neighborhood.The reason Blue Weight Control was not the best Blue Buffalo food for my dog was because it is is relatively calorie dense-- 444 calories per cup. To feed him 670 total calories per day, I could only feed him 1.5 cups per day, meaning that each of his two meals could only be 3/4 cups, and that was without even a tiny buffer for a single green bean as a treat. (Later I explain why I had to add-in other foods.  I ended up only feeding him 2/3 of a cup for each meal, and that really worried me about the adequacy of his nutrition. This quantity of food is well below the feeding guidelines on the bag. My dog was miserable and begged constantly. He would even lick his empty bowl between meals.  I tried feeding him a 1/3 cup (10 calories) of plain no-added-salt canned green beans as a snack, just to help fill his stomach, but he was not content and eventually turned his nose up at the green bean snacks.  I should have added warm water to his dog food and stirred in the green beans, but I wasn't smart enough to do so at the time. My dog kept acting hungry and begging for more dog food.  He would actually walk over to the bag of dog food, put his paw on it, and look at me while whining softly! Other members of my household would sneak table food to him because he begged so persistently, and the "diet" was a abysmal failure.  My poor dog ended up actually gaining 4 more pounds from all the human cheating!I was glad I found Blue Longevity adult food.  It has 354 calories per cup as opposed to 444. It has 3.384 calories/gram.  I gave my dog 1.8 cups per day (in 2 meals) for 640 calories. A saleswomen at Petsmart explained that I could help increase my dog's feeling of fullness even more by adding warm water to to his food, enough to just cover the kibble, and letting it sit on the counter a minute so that the kibble would swell up. I should then stir in 10 calories (a little less than 1/4 cup) of no-added-salt green beans to make it an even more filling meal. I did all of these changes together, so I can't separate the effects. My dog stopped the whining and began to lose the weight.I budgeted him only 10 calories per day for treats. The problem was, I had to find something to give as a treat at least 3 times per day.  See, my dog lived in a no-kill shelter for 18 month, so I had to use treats to re-housebreak him. Now he refuses to do #2 unless he is guaranteed a treat (if he doesn't get one immediately after he goes, he lies down on the ground and makes us carry him home--even if we are two blocks from the house and it is dark and pooring down rain. Welcome to my world of loving an Australian Cattle Dog.) I was surprised to learn that small sized Milk Bones have 20 calories each and contributed to him getting overweight to begin with. Even breaking one in half wasn't enough to make his treat calories reasonable. I found a bite-sized treat that is only 1-2 calories called 

Premier Liver Biscoti Dog Treats, Original Recipe, Original Bite Size, 8oz. Bag

  ).  They were fine as a substitute for Milk Bones. I recently found a 2-calorie  treat that my dog is crazy about called 

Zuke's Mini Naturals Salmon Dog Treats

   (not to be confused with the 10-calorie each 

Zuke's Mini Bakes Chicken N Cherryz, 16 oz

  . My dog would probably walk through fire for the Salmon flavored ones, but he also likes the peanut butter flavored ones.Update: I eventually found a web site called DogFoodAdvisor.com.  Through it, I found another food called 

Premium Edge Healthy Weight I Weight Reduction Formula Adult Dry Dog Food, 35-Pound

   that has the same calories per cup as Longevity but that has twice as much protein (also from high quality sources!) It is also grain-free (dogs don't need grains in their diet at all) and a little less expensive per pound.  It helped my dog build muscle and lose weight.

If you eat healthy, why shouldn't your dog? This brand is SO great at providing natural and healthy ingredients in my dog's diet. I own a large dog that has a sensitive stomach and is prone to allergies. We started him off slow with Blue Buffalo and he has had no problems whatsoever. He LOVES the taste of it too if gobbling it up as soon as it hits the bowl is any sign. He is usually not the type of dog that eats RIGHT AWAY. We've tried to keep him on a schedule so he doesn't just eat whenever he feels like it. It's been tough, but this food has helped to encourage him to eat his food when it's set out. As a family we have been trying to eat natural, organic, and whole unprocessed foods. We decided our dog should get the same great diet and results we've been feeling.

reviews.review_title: Would not recommend, Have carpet cleaner on hand
reviews.review_text: I have a German Shepherd and a American bull mix. I decided to switch from Taste of the Wild dog food to this Blue Buffalo weight management. My American bulldog mix was getting overweight and i wanted to help her shed a few pounds using this food since the TOTW is pretty high in fat.  The countless positive reviews on petsmart and mostly good on amazon had me sold. I really wish i had tried a different food now. I noticed both dogs stool was a little soft when i was gradually changing them over. Which i didn't think much of. Once i completely switched them over, it was probably the first night i was awoken to one of my dogs having terrible diarrhea on my carpet. (which is a lovely aroma to wake up to) She also threw up a couple times that day and the next as well. So i took her to the vet and everything was normal, the vet gave her some meds just in case it was a stomach bug. The next day my Shepherd starting having the same terrible diarrhea and went in the house. The food is the only thing that has changed with my dogs so i really have no doubt it is what has caused all of the problems. I'm going to discontinue using this food immediately and probably go back to the TOTW. I would use this food with caution!

my rescue dog has always thrown up a lot. a few times a week at times.he also likes to eat grass. i switched around to various dog foods looking for the answer. after buying blue buffalo life protection he has only thrown up once in a month. he has also quit eating grass. i didn't have to blend blue buffalo with how old dog food. i just poured it in his bowl and he loved it. this is a PICKY dog as well. some dog foods he just wouldn't eat. i know that blue buffalo has superior ingredients to most grocery stores food. this has made a BIG difference in the way he looks and act as well. not having to clean up dog throw up a few times a week is worth the extra cost between cheap dog food and great dog food. the dogs that died from poisons in their food were from cheap, artificial ingredients. i love my dog so much i would do anything and spend anything to keep him around longer. wouldn't you?

I have a german shepherd mix that weighs 64 pounds.  She has done really well on this food.  Her coat has become very shiny and she doesn't have the gas problem that she had on the other dog food that we tried.

I was feeding my dog Wellness brand food and he seemed to be bored with it after a few months so I bought this. He was so excited about the new food and didn't hesitate to scarf it down. He has never had much problem eating anything I buy him, but keeping his interest can be a bit of a problem. The food smells nice (for dog food), kinda earthy and natural. He is still interested in it after several weeks and his energy seems good. He is white and has a sensitive coat and this stuff does well to keep his coat shiny so far. I gave it four stars because it gives him gas (not fun for him or me) and he is not fully adjusted yet (some loose stools). I'm not sure if we will get it again.

Our pug has flourished on this food.  He suffered from a bit of acne on his muzzle, and after eating BLUE, it's cleared up.  He's lost a few pounds and is now at his ideal weight.  He loves the food and we can see the benefits of this product.  We highly recommend it!

reviews.review_title: You Can Please All of the Dogs Some of the Time....
reviews.review_text: Love, love, love the ease, convenience, and PRICING of this dog food!  Bought one small bag at PetCo locally before ordering the 30-lb bag thru Amazon, and paid almost the same price.  Downside:  We have a spoiled "Princess" dog who is very choosy about her food, and to be honest, there has been none that she seems to like (and we've tried 'em all....)  So if your pooch is a fan of the Blue Buffalo brand, this is definitely the way to go....ESPECIALLY with the free shipping.  Can't fault this product because we have a finicky-appetite dog.

I first bought blue buffalo for my dogs and I can they can't keep there noses out if it. They don't go all over the yard and they don't have any skin problems any more. If my dogs are happy then I am happy. Maybe it will keep them out of the Vet's office. Happy lakewood dog owner

If you have not tried Blue Buffalo, you just must.  This is an outstanding product, my dogs LOVE it, even the diet kind!  The quality is the best.  Please do NOT feed your dogs any of the commercial dog foods, find a quality food that will extend their lives.  Do you research to find out what goes into your pet's food.  It will save their lives.My dogs now JUMP and wiggle when it's time to feed them rather than ignore their food.  They are healthier and their joints are doing much better (they are 11 years old).  Their itching has stopped too.CANNOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT HIGH ENOUGH!!  TRY IT.

October 8, 2010. The Blue Buffalo Company of Wilton, Connecticut has announced a dog food recall of certain batches of some of its popular products due to potentially toxic levels of vitamin D.My dog got extremely sick, and was very upset to hear of this.  Only thing that changed with his diet/life was blue buffalo.  I literally almost lost my dog last week and had to have in surgery because his gallbladder was about to explode.  He quit eating completely, was throwing up, diarrhea, and took him to the vet to realize his liver was swollen and gallbladder had to come out.  It's sad to think you pay good money for dog food and you still could be feeding him poison.  I don't know how I will every trust dog food products anymore.  Please make sure there is no recalls on food you are feeding your dog.

reviews.review_title: Blue is a very special dog or cat food
reviews.review_text: When I first got my dogs (one is a black lab and the other is a black mouth cur) about two years ago, I did a lot of research on dog food and found only a few brands I would consider. I am very happy with both the quality ingredients in Blue and that I can also buy it in cat food for my two cats. My cats (which were strays) were diagnosed two years ago with Feline Immune Virus (cat equivalent of HIV), but have stayed healthy with no symptons. I attribute this, in part, to their diet. The dogs' coats are shiny and they have lots of energy. Both my dogs and cats love Blue. In fact, one of my cats, even when his Blue cat food is sitting right there, will sometimes try to eat the dog food. This says a lot about Blue's ingredients because very few cats will choose to eat dry dog food.Mostly, I buy the chicken and rice but I switch flavors sometimes. My animals like all the flavors and I have not noticed any strong odors--just normal food odors--that others have mentioned. I am also fortunate that my pets don't refuse to eat the black kibbles. Dry pet food containing meat has to be processed at high heat for safety, but heat destroys enzymes and many nutrients. The black kibbles are the ones that contain Omega 3 oils for a healthy heart and other special nutrients. Blue makes them with a special cold process so as not to destroy the probiotics. If the animals don't eat the black kibbles it is like they are not eating their vitamins. The black kibbles are what sets Blue apart from any other dry dog food that I am aware of--even the ones with similar high quality ingredients.

reviews.review_title: The only food we'll feed our dogs.
reviews.review_text: I don't want to eat or feed my family bi-product, so why in the world would I want to feed it to my dogs? Thus the reason we feed our German Shepherd and Boxer/Pitbull Blue Buffalo. We do the weight control as our Shepherd was a little hefty. In 6 months he's lost 6 pounds...which, for a dog, is a lot. He looks so much healthier! We love this food....I do wish they came in 50 or 60lb bags tho.

Blue Buffalo Weight Control Formula Dry Dog Food, 15-Pound Bag

The 5 stars are from my two fat Hot Dogs. They just love the little nuggets.As for whether or not it shall help slim them down, it's too early to tell but I sure hope so.

The product is great overall. I just wanted to point out that my dog had a really bad case of shedding. After I change the food to Blue Buffalo the shedding stop almost completely. Two other friends had the same problem with their dogs. The also switched to Blue Buffalo and the shedding was reduced dramatically too. I did not know the importance of buying quality food, now I know.

Blue has a great list of ingredients, no artificial coloring, and my dog likes it.  I alternate buying this brand and Halo so my dog doesn't get tired of her food.  I would recommend Blue to any dog owner.

This stuff is great!  All 3 of my dogs love this dog food and they have all been on it for 2 years now without a problem.  The ingredients are very high quality too.  My sister and my parents have all started feeding their dogs Blue Buffalo too, and all of their dogs love it as well.  I don't have a single complaint about this dog food.
smells like good food...no cardboard dog food!  dogs eat less and are satisfied sooner!found it for $38.99 locally, amazon is a little too pricey.Update:  It is currently $42.99 locally.

reviews.review_title: this food can be found for much, much less at petco
reviews.review_text: I can not believe what a scam this is ?  this is expensive high quality food however it can be purchased for half the price or more at local pet centers like Petco, which is not inexpensive retail in my opinion. PLEASE beware and shop around!
Yes, she loves it. My Borzoi looks forward to the Blue Buffalo Dry food as part of her daily feedings. It is a quality product as are all of their items.
One of my three dogs won't eat the "life source bits" so she's constantly spitting them out hence we have life source bits all over the flippin' house.  Won't be buying it again.

reviews.review_title: I like the food, sadly, my dog doesn't :(
reviews.review_text: I read a lot about this food prior to making my purchase. My dog recently suffered from life-threatening bloat...amazingly she survived :) To reduce the chances of future bloat I am now feeding her 4-5 times a day instead of only once. After researching, I found that a food high in protein and low in carbs/corn type grains was healthier and possibly less likely to cause bloat (there is very little known as to the causes of bloat so most information is just theoretical...no definitive findings). Well, I was happy to find that Blue Buffalo foods seemed to be tailored to exactly what I was in search of! In addition, my dog suffers from allergies and I had been supplementing her with Alaskan Salmon Oil for added Omega-3 and Omega-6. After reading about the Blue Buffalo Fish & Sweet Potato food I saw that it offered the additional Omega's and that if she was to eat it I would no longer need to do the separate supplement. Everything sounded wonderful! I placed my order and it arrived promptly. I tried getting her to eat the food for about a week or two before I decided it was a no go :( I tried mixing it with hot water for gravy...still, she never did take to it. She is typically a very accepting dog when new foods are introduced...however, with this food she was not.
